            <section>
                <section>
                    <h1>:(</h1>
                </section>
                <div class="warn">
                    <div mask="warn"></div>
                    <p>Your browser seems to block the execution of <code><b>javascript</b></code>.</p>
                    <p>However, this site relies on javascript and other modern web features.</p>
                </div>
                <p>Please consider the following:</p>
                <ul>
                    <li>Ensure that your browser is up-to-date.</li>
                    <li>Try to avoid using a deprecated browser (like Internet Explorer).</li>
                    <li>Find the <code><b>javascript</b></code> option in your browser settings and enable it.</li>
                </ul>
                <p>When <code><b>javascript</b></code> is enabled, this page will automatically redirect to the root page of the <a href="./index.html">C15 Reference</a>. If the problem still persists, we recommend to try another browser.</p>
                <div class="note">
                    <div mask="note"></div>
                    <p>In most modern browsers, the settings are available in the main browser menu - usually located on the top-right of the window.</p>
                    <p>Commonly, the settings can also be searched for specific keywords. Another common feature is to load the settings page or specific settings by typing directly into the address bar.</p>
                </div>
                <p>However, this all depends on the browser you are using:</p>
                    <dl>
                        <dt>Chrome/Chromium, Opera</dt>
                        <dd class="section">
                            <p>Find the browser settings in the main menu and search for <code><b>javascript</b></code>. There should be an option for <code><b>javascript</b></code> in the <span class="keyword"><code class="key">Privacy and security</code>/ Site Settings</span> section, which should be set to "Allowed (recommended)".</p>
                            <p>(Alternatively, you can type <code><b>chrome://settings/content/javascript</b></code> in the address bar.)</p>
                        </dd>
                        <dt>Safari</dt>
                        <dd class="section">
                            <p>Find the browser settings in the main menu under <span class="keyword"><code class="key">Preferences...</code></span>. There should be a <span class="keyword"><code class="key">Security</code></span> icon, opening the corresponding tab. In the <code><b>Web content</b></code> section, an option for <code><b>javascript</b></code> should be available. It should be set to enabled.</p>
                        </dd>
                        <dt>Firefox</dt>
                        <dd class="section">
                            <p>Type <span class="keyword"><code class="key">about:config</code></span> in the address bar, redirecting to the settings page. Search for <code><b>javascript</b></code> and find the <span class="keyword"><code class="key">javascript.enabled</code></span> option. It should be set to enabled.</p>
                        </dd>
                        <dt>Edge</dt>
                        <dd>
                            <p>Open the settings page from the browser menu. You can search for <code><b>javascript</b></code> or find the option under <span class="keyword"><code class="key">Site permissions</code>/ JavaScript</span>. It should be set to "Allowed (recommended)".</p>
                        </dd>
                    </dl>
            </section>
        </main>
    </div>

<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="1">Goals and Requirements</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3>Bundled Documentation</h3>
        <p>The <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a> aims to bundle all available documentation (manuals, info sheets, tutorials, ...) in one single static HTML project.</p>
        <p>By that premise, the whole documentation is organized within a single directory, servable via the official website and/or the embedded NUC. The project structure also aims for github integration in the future.</p>
        <p>Required resources (images, css, javascript, fonts) are contained within the project and are available for all pages. Most resources are structured in a modular fashion.</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3>Static (but reduced) HTML</h3>
        <p>The project does not use any precompilers, it is plain HTML in combination with (modern) CSS and Javascript.</p>
        <p>The project aims for the support of <b>http</b> (web) and <b>file</b> (local) protocols, so it can also be placed on the USB stick. This however means, that many modern features are not available due to browser restrictions (CORS policies and alike).</p>
        <p>The effort of producing content should be as reduced as possible (avoiding any redundancies if possible). For example, the menu and navigation of documents (or their chapters) is realized by <b>iframe</b> elements, so they effectively are another shared resource. The Table of Contents for all documents and chapters is contained within this single file: <a href="./documents/_content.html" target="_blank">./documents/_content.html</a>.</p>
        <p>Developer information is separated (./developer folder) and hidden by default. When using the Developer Option, those documents (and hidden comments) will become visible/available.</p>
        <p>Specific pages can be printed. The printing format is rather primitie at the moment, but should suffice to print on A4 pages.</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3>Constant access to Navigation, Responsive design</h3>
        <p>The user should always be able to quickly navigate between documents or chapters. This should not be affected by circumstances like the page scroll position or screen/window dimensions.</p>
        <p>A Menu section provides different means of navigation and access to settings. Using a wide screen, it will be available on the left of the window. On narrow screens, it is available as an overlay and accessable via a menu button on the top-right.</p>
        <p>At any moment, the user should be able to quickly browse different pages.</p>
        <p>The legacy scroll-to-top mechanism is also available.</p>
        <p>Besides, three Color Themes are supported: dark (ignoring system/browser preference), auto (using system/browser preference), light (ignoring system/browser preference). Images are intended to be present in three variations: -dark, -light, -print. (The attribute has to be present in the file name, f.e. image-dark.png) As -print variations are not present at the moment, the -light variation will be taken when printing a page. (Feature is optional and can be set in shared.js)</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3>Requirements</h3>
        <p>We aim for modern browsers and do not support "historical" pre Web 2.0 stuff. So, CSS3 and Javascript are required.</p>
    </section>
</main>
</div>

<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="2">Layout and Implementation</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3>Noscript Fallback</h3>
        <p>As Javascript is required, a <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/noscript" _target="_blank">noscript</a> fallback is implemented on every page. If the used browser does not provide enabled Javascript, the user will be automatically redirected to a central <a href="./_noscript.html" _target="_blank">error</a> page when trying to open a file.</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3>Responsive Page Layout</h3>
        <p><a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/Media_Queries/Using_media_queries" _target="_blank">CSS Media Queries</a> are used to support narrow screens on mobile devices (phone, tablet).</p>
        <p>On narrow screens, there is still a header present, providing the current location (<code>root/which_document/which_chapter</code>). Also, a menu icon ( <button class="menu"><div mask="menu"></div></button> ) will be available, opening the navigation and settings section as an overlay on the whole screen.</p>
        <p>Should the user want to print a page, a separate print layout will become effective. For example, the navigation and settings section will not be avaibale here and a light and grayscale coloring applies (regardless of the currently active color theme).</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3>Automatic Generation</h3>
        <p>The declared goal of avoiding redundancies, especially in the HTML part, is realized in several ways.</p>
        <p>Javascript will automatically create the menu section (Documents, Settings) for a particular page. Also, the current document and chapter is determined and will be shown in the list of available documents and chapters (Documents). Subchapters will become available as well. In order for this to work, Javascript uses <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/URLSearchParams" _target="_blank">URLSearchParams</a> and passes them to iframe elements. The Color Theme setting and Developer Mode is also implemented via those params. (They also would "survive" bookmarking a specific page)</p>
        <p>Javascript also ensures that images will switch their content following the active <b>color theme</b>. This also requires the <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window/matchMedia" _target="_blank">matchMedia</a> object. Usually, color-scheme-aware pictures require much HTML, as compared to mere images. Javascript will also take care of that, so the author just needs to use a simple <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/picture" _target="_blank">picture</a> element and can specify image variations with a wildcard pattern:</p>
        <table>
            <tr>
                <td>
                    <code>
                        <p><b>&lt;picture&gt;</b></p>
                        <p style="text-indent: 2ch;"><b>&lt;source</b> srcset="image-dark.jpg" media="(prefers-color-scheme: dark)"<b>&gt;</b></p>
                        <p style="text-indent: 2ch;"><b>&lt;source</b> srcset="image-light.jpg" media="(prefers-color-scheme: light)"<b>&gt;</b></p>
                        <p style="text-indent: 2ch;"><b>&lt;img</b> src="image-print.jpg"<b>&gt;</b></p>
                        <p><b>&lt;/picture&gt;</b></p>
                    </code>
                </td>
                <td>
                    <p>This is the usual HTML code for defining color-scheme-aware pictures.</p>
                </td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
                <td>
                    <code>
                        <p><b>&lt;picture</b> data-src="image-*.jpg"<b>&gt;</b><b>&lt;/picture&gt;</b></p>
                    </code>
                </td>
                <td>
                    <p>Javascript reduces the HTML drastically by exploiting a wildcard pattern. </p>
                </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
        <p>In addition, Javascript also realizes and reduces HTML for:</p>
        <ul>
            <li><a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/figure" taret="blank">figure</a> elements that can be maximized <i>(shown in an overlay over the whole screen when clicking on the maximize <button class="menu"><div mask="maximize"></div></button> icon)</i></li>
            <li>highlighted elements/sections (warnings, notes, developer comments, keywords)</li>
        </ul>
    </section>
</main>
</div>
</body>

<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="3">Structure and Components</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3>Structure</h3>
        <p>The overall project structure looks something like this:</p>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <ul class="toc">
                <li class="folder open">
                    <a>C15 Documentation</a>
                    <ul class="toc">
                        <li class="folder"><a>css</a></li>
                        <li class="folder"><a>developer</a></li>
                        <li class="folder open">
                            <a>documents</a>
                            <ul class="toc">
                                <li class="folder open">
                                    <a>man-user</a>
                                    <ul class="toc">
                                        <li class="folder open">
                                            <a>00-preface</a>
                                            <ul class="toc">
                                                <li><a>00-1-safety.html</a></li>
                                                <li>(...)</li>
                                            </ul>
                                        </li>
                                        <li>(...)</li>
                                        <li><a>index.html</a></li>
                                    </ul>
                                </li>
                                <li>(...)</li>
                                <li><a>_content.html</a></li>
                            </ul>
                        </li>
                        <li class="folder"><a>favicon</a></li>
                        <li class="folder"><a>fonts</a></li>
                        <li class="folder open">
                            <a>images</a>
                            <ul class="toc">
                                <li class="folder"><a>diagrams</a></li>
                                <li class="folder"><a>hardware-ui</a></li>
                                <li class="folder"><a>package</a></li>
                                <li class="folder"><a>symbols</a></li>
                                <li class="folder"><a>web-ui</a></li>
                            </ul>
                        </li>
                        <li class="folder"><a>js</a></li>
                        <li><a>_menu.html</a></li>
                        <li><a>_noscript.html</a></li>
                        <li><a>index.html</a></li>
                    </ul>
                </li>
            </ul>
            <div>
                <p>The main folder contains:</p>
                <br>
                <p><b>css</b>: four css files (for iframe and primary content) within a folder.</p>
                <br>
                <p><b>developer</b>: content that is only visible in developer mode.</p>
                <br>
                <p><b>documents</b>: actual user-relevant documents.</p>
                <p>They can contain subfolders for chapters in case there are too many files. They also have an index page (the document title page).</p>
                <p>One single file (_content.html) holds all navigational links to documents, chapters and subchapters.</p>
                <br>
                <p><b>favicon, fonts</b>: shared resources</p>
                <br>
                <p><b>images</b>: images are shared resources and as a proposal, they are organized thematically - with no association to a specific document or chapter.</p>
                <br>
                <p><b>js</b>: four javascript files (organized similar to css files)</p>
                <br>
                <p>In the <b>main</b> folder, there is the main index landing page, the noscript fallback and a subpage for displaying the menu content (Documents, Settings).</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3>Creating Documents</h3>
        <p>The procedure requires the author to create a new "document" folder and corresponding html pages in the ./documents folder. To got startet fast and easy, just clone the ./developer/template folder (<a href="./developer/template/index.html">Template Document</a>). The minimal required HTML for the title and chapter pages and an overview of usable components is provided.</p>
        <p>The next necessary step is to provide links in the ./documents/_content.html file, following the given hirarchy. In order for this to work, path attributes are used. The path of this page is <code>root/man-developer/03-structure-and-components</code>. Sections in the _content.html file will translate this path step by step. Javascript resolves that path and determines, which document and chapter links will be shown. The path size is arbitrary, but should not be too big. It has to be unique between all documents, chapters and subchapters.</p>
        <p>Once the document and it's first chapter exists, the process of adding more chapters is more or less copy-paste action. The inner organization does not follow a specific rule. It mainly depends on the document size and number of files. Long single pages are possible (but not always practical) as well as large amounts of files (possibly within subfolders).</p>
        <p>File- and folder names should not contain spaces.</p>
        <p>Other possible resources like images may be added to the shared ./images folder or fitting subfolder.</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3>Components</h3>
        <p>[tbc]</p>
    </section>

<script>
    const test = document.querySelector("main").appendChild(document.createElement("section"));
    test.innerHTML = "<h2>Font Symbols</h2><br>";
    const start = 0xE000, count = 0x0320, line = 0x10;
    let str = "<div style='font-size: 112.5%; text-align: center;'>"
    for(let j = start; j < start + count; j += line) {
        str += `<div style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(${line + 1}, 1fr); gap: 4px; margin-bottom: 0.5rem;"><b>${j.toString(16).toUpperCase()}</b>`;
        for(let i = j; i < j + line; i++) {
            const code = i.toString(16).toUpperCase();
            // str += `<span title="${code}">&#x${code};</span>`;
            str += `<span title="${code}">${String.fromCharCode(i)}</span>`;
        }
        str += "</div>"
    }
    str += "</div><br><br>"
    test.innerHTML += str;
</script>

    </label>

<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 class="heading primary"><span class="sw-version">20-28</span> C15 Software Update 2020</h2>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>The C15 received a major update of the operating system, the Synth Engine and the User Interface. The update includes <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Layer"></span>, <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Split"></span> and <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Mono"></span> modes, more voices, and more <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Macro">Controls</span> and <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Modulation">Targets</span>.</p>
        </div>
        <p>This update continues the constant evolution of the C15 since its launch nearly three years ago. It expands the range and quality of sounds and improves the playability and suitability for musical performance.</p>
        <p>The new software is a complete rewrite. Based on the new architecture, future developments will be easier and will also benefit from new opportunities. The Synth Engine and the User Interface now both run on Linux.</p>
        <p>The update is free for all C15 users, who will also benefit from the interchangeable magnetic foils, as the new version comes with updated overlays reflecting the new features.</p>
        <h3>Enhanced Quality and Performance</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <ul>
                <li>More efficient sound engine: 24 voices (before: 20), two complete effects chains</li>
                <li>Sample-precise envelope times</li>
                <li>Enhanced velocity resolution</li>
            </ul>
            <ul>
                <li>Optimized keyboard latency</li>
                <li>Improved glitch suppression for preset recalls</li>
                <li>Support for more types of pedals and footswitches</li>
                <li>Better linearisation of the Ribbons</li>
            </ul>
        </div>
        <h3>Dual Modes</h3>
        <p>The 24 voices can be split into two <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Voicegroups"></span> <i>(groups of 12 voices for <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Part"></span> <span data-utf="ind-part-1"></span> and <span data-utf="ind-part-2"></span>)</i>, loading different presets. Each Part contains a complete effect section. The voice allocation can run in <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Split"></span> or <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Layer"> Mode</span>.</p>
        <dl>
            <dt>
                <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Split"> Mode</span>
            </dt>
            <dd>
                <p><span class="keyword" data-keyword="Part"></span> <span data-utf="ind-part-1"></span> and <span data-utf="ind-part-2"></span> are assigned to different key ranges.</p>
            </dd>
            <dt>
                <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Layer"> Mode</span>
            </dt>
            <dd>
                <p>Voices from <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Part"></span> <span data-utf="ind-part-1"></span> and <span data-utf="ind-part-2"></span> are stacked per key.</p>
            </dd>
        </dl>
        <p>The Feedback Mixer now has additional channels to receive signals from the other <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Part"></span>. This means that in <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Layer">mode</span> the two voices not only can run in parallel but their signal processing can be combined in serial and feedback structures, allowing e.g. 4-operator PM or 8-pole filters.</p>
        <p>The <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Layer">mode</span> also offers crossfades that are controlled by the velocity or the key position.</p>
        <h3>Monophonic Modes</h3>
        <p>The voice allocation now supports monophonic playing with Lowest, Highest and Last Key priority, four different Legato modes and an adjustable Glide time. <i>(Up to 24 unison voices can be layered.)</i></p>
        <h3>Six Macro Controls</h3>
        <p>The four existing <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Macro">Controls</span> (<span data-utf="mc-a"></span>, <span data-utf="mc-b"></span>, <span data-utf="mc-c"></span>, <span data-utf="mc-d"></span>) are extended by <span data-utf="mc-e"></span> and <span data-utf="mc-f"></span>. All six Macros are also available in the <span class="keyword" data-keyword="MC">View</span>, a 2-D control surface for touch screens.</p>
        <h3>More Modulation Targets</h3>
        <p>Additional parameters (e.g. the Oscillator Phases) can be assigned to the <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Macro">Controls</span>.</p>
        <h3>New Parameters</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <ul>
                <li>Envelope A/B: Velocity amounts for the Decay 1 and Decay 2 times</li>
                <li>Envelope A/B: Elevate can raise the Breakpoint and Sustain levels for the timbre or the amplitude of an oscillator.</li>
                <li>Envelope C: Retrigger Hardness can control the starting point of mono voices</li>
                <li>Oscillator A/B: Reset can be disabled for free-running mode</li>
                <li>Tremolo effect as an extension of the Flanger</li>
                <li>Dual mode: Volume and Tune for <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Part"></span> <span data-utf="ind-part-1"></span> and <span data-utf="ind-part-2"></span></li>
            </ul>
            <ul>
                <li>Layer mode: Fade From (key), Fade Range</li>
                <li>Feedback Mixer: more inputs for cross routing in <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Layer">mode</span></li>
                <li>Output Mixer: signal split to both Dual mode effect chains</li>
                <li>Individual smoothing times for the six <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Macro">Controls</span></li>
                <li>Setting: Adjustable tuning reference: 440 +/-40 Hz</li>
            </ul>
        </div>
        <h3>Extended Parameter Ranges and Resolutions</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <ul>
                <li>Unison with up to 24 voices (before: 12)</li>
                <li>Bipolar Level Velocity amounts (for velocity crossfades)</li>
            </ul>
            <ul>
                <li>Internal high-resolution parameter format</li>
            </ul>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>

<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 class="heading secondary"><span class="sw-version">20-52</span> Dual Mode Improvements and new Features</h2>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>The big update in the Summer of 2020 was followed by a number of bugfix updates. Now in version <span class="sw-version">20-52</span> we bring some new features and functional improvements especially for the <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Split"></span> and <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Layer"></span> modes. Therefore please check this list of changes, and also see the full description in the <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html" class="label">User Manual</a>.</p>
        </div>
        <h3>Split Sounds: Key Ranges Can Overlap</h3>
        <p>In earlier versions, the C15 only provided one Split Point parameter in a <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Split">Sound</span>, determining the inner edges of both fully separated <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Parts"></span>, so no overlap was possible.</p>
        <p>The described behavior is still available by default and referred to as <q>linked</q> Split Points. Now, <q>unlinked</q> Split Points are avialable as well, providing separate Split Points for each <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Part"></span> <i>(but still sharing one unique <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Macro">Control</span> assignment)</i>.</p>
        <p>When unlinked, an overlapping range of shared keys can be defined, in which both <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Parts"></span> will sound. A negative overlap (a key range with no Part association) will be prevented.</p>
        <h3 data-detail="Graphical UI only">Editors</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <div class="section">
                <h4>Split Point Editor (Split Sounds)</h4>
                <p>In the <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Sound">Tab</span>, the righmost icon redirects to the Split Point Editor, providing the two parameters and an interactive visual representation. Split Points can be set by clicking or dragging on the corresponding values or by dragging the indicators on the shown keybed. The linking behavior can be set as well.</p>
            </div>
            <div class="section">
                <h4>Key Fade Editor (Layer Sounds)</h4>
                <p>In the <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Sound">Tab</span>, the righmost icon redirects to the Key Fade Editor, providing all related aspects and an interactive visual representation. For each <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Part"></span>, Fade From and Fade Range can be adjusted by clicking or dragging on the corresponding values or by dragging the indicators shown on the keybed.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 data-detail="Hardware UI, Graphical UI">Indicators</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <ul>
                <li><u>Cross-Feedback</u>: <q>FB</q> arrows are shown in the <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Sound">Screen/Tab</span> of <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Layer">Sounds</span>, when the <q>A/B I/II</q> and <q>From I/II</q> parameters of the Feedback Mixer create a connection between a voice of <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Part"></span> <span data-utf="ind-part-1"></span> and a voice of <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Part"></span> <span data-utf="ind-part-2"></span>.</li>
                <li><u>Cross-Send</u>: <q>FX</q> arrows are shown in the <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Sound">Screen/Tab</span> of <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Split"></span> and <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Layer">Sounds</span>, when the <q>To FX I/II</q> parameters create a signal flow to the effects of the other <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Part"></span>.</li>
            </ul>
            <ul>
                <li><u>Macro Control Targets</u>: In the <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Macro Control">Screen</span> of the Hardware UI up to four literal symbols are shown to indicate target parameters that cannot be indicated by Selection Panel LEDs. (<b>M</b> - Master Volume/Tune, <b>u</b> - Unison Detune, <b>m</b> - Mono Glide, <b>P</b> - Part Volume/Tune or Split Point)</li>
                <li><u>Key Fades</u>: When a <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Part"></span> of a <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Layer">Sound</span> is affected by a Key Fade, this will be indicated in the <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Sound">Screen/Tab</span> by a small fade graph next to the Part Volume.</li>
            </ul>
        </div>
        <h3 data-detail="Setup Menu">Settings</h3>
        <ul>
            <li><u>Device Settings / Sync Parts across UIs</u>: For <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Split"></span> and <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Layer">Sounds</span>, different <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Parts"></span> can be shown on the C15's <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Panel Unit">Display</span> and on one or multiple instances of the <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Graphical">UI</span>. This can be useful but in many cases it was confusing. Therefore the normal behaviour is now that the Part selection is applied once to all UIs, corresponding to <q>Sync Parts across UIs</q> being on. When the option is set off the Parts can be selected separately.</li>
            <li><u>Hardware UI / Screensaver Timeout</u>: An optional timeout setting has been added in order to prevent possible pixel deterioration in the two displays, which can occur when the C15 is running for longer periods of time without any interaction.</li>
        </ul>
        <h3>Part Mute Will Not Mute Additional Signal Paths</h3>
        <p>Unlike in earlier versions, the muting of a <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Part"></span> of a <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Layer">Sound</span>, will only affect the final Part Volume stage. So any signal flow across Parts will be maintained regardless.</p>
        <h3>Extended Internal Key Range</h3>
        <p>In earlier versions, the C15 only operated on its physical key range of 61 keys (C1 ... C6). In this version, a virtual key range of 128 keys (C-2 ... G8) was added. The physical key range of 61 keys is now projected onto the virtual key range, depending on the Note Shift, which is now a real key shift and not a tuning anymore.</p>
        <h3 data-detail="Graphical UI">Shortcuts for Part Selection</h3>
        <p>The keys <q>1</q> and <q>2</q> of the computer keyboard can be used to select Part <span data-utf="ind-part-1"></span> or <span data-utf="ind-part-2"></span>.</p>
        <h3>Bug Fixes and Performance Improvements</h3>
        <p>We constantly strive to improve the quality and efficiency of the C15's software.</p>
    </section>
</main>
</div>

<main>
    <section>
        <h2 class="heading secondary"><span class="sw-version">21-07</span> Bugfixes and UI Improvements</h2>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>This software update for the C15 comes with some bug fixes and improvements for the user interfaces of version <span class="sw-version">20-52</span> and version <span class="sw-version">21-02</span>.</p>
        </div>
        <div data-highlight="warn">
            <h3>IMPORTANT</h3>
            <p>If you update from version <span class="sw-version">21-02</span> you might get the error message <q>Updating C15 FAILED</q> during the installation. In this case the installer needs to be run a second time. Please restart the C15 without removing the USB stick. Now the update should be successful.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>

<!-- menu: location -->
<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/change-log/index.html">Change Log</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/change-log/21-26.html">Studio Package Update 2021</a>
    </label>
</div>
<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 class="heading primary"><span class="sw-version">21-26</span> Studio Package Update 2021</h2>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>The C15 gets a major update that includes USB MIDI connectivity and an internal digital audio recorder. For connecting the C15 directly to a computer we are offering a new small hardware device called the <a href="./documents/man-midi-bridge/index.html">MIDI Bridge</a>.</p>
        </div>
        <p>Again this update continues the constant evolution of the C15 since its launch. Last summer we extended the synth engine by <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Split"></span>, <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Layer"></span> and <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Mono"></span> modes, new parameters and added more <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Macro">Controls</span>.</p>
        <p>The current implementation of a <span class="keyword" data-keyword="MIDI"></span> interface is now widening up the spectrum of applications for the C15, especially in the studio environment.</p>
        <p>The second feature included in this software release is an internal digital recorder. It automatically stores the audio output signal of the last hours in the C15.</p>
        <h3>USB MIDI</h3>
        <dl>
            <dt>
                <h4>Features at a glance</h4>
            </dt>
            <dd data-columns="2">
                <ul>
                    <li>Transmits and receives notes, positions of the <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Hardware">Sources</span>, Program Changes</li>
                    <li>Up to 90 parameters can be modulated via the <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Macro">Controls</span></li>
                    <li>14-bit resolution for Note Velocities and for Controls available</li>
                </ul>
                <ul>
                    <li>Separate MIDI Channels for <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Split"></span> zones and <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Parts"></span> of the Synth Engine available</li>
                    <li>Local On/Off</li>
                </ul>
            </dd>
            <dt>
                <h4>Connecting the C15 to a USB Device</h4>
            </dt>
            <dd>
                <p>The USB host interface of the C15 can be directly connected to USB MIDI devices.</p>
                <p>The C15 has a Type A connector for USB, and its embedded computer system works as a <q>USB host</q> for <q>USB devices</q> connected to this port. This means that you only need a standard USB cable to set up a MIDI communication with an instrument, a hardware sequencer, or a MIDI interface, or any device with a USB Type B connector.</p>
            </dd>
            <dt>
                <h4>Connecting the C15 using 5-pole DIN Connectors</h4>
            </dt>
            <dd>
                <p>To use the classical MIDI cables and 5-pin DIN Ins and Outs a USB MIDI interface can be connected as an USB device directly to the USB port of the C15.</p>
            </dd>
            <dt>
                <h4>High Resolution Mode</h4>
            </dt>
            <dd>
                <p>As classical MIDI operates on 7 bit resolution (128 steps), there is a loss in accuracy. The C15 operates on much higher precision. Nevertheless, precision can be maintained by enabling the <q>High Resolution</q> options.</p>
                <p></p>
            </dd>
        </dl>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>For more information, please refer to the User Manual, chapter <a href="./documents/man-user/07-midi/07-00-midi.html" data-number="7">MIDI</a>.</p>
        </div>
        <h3>MIDI Bridge - Connecting the C15 to a Computer</h3>
        <p>For the connection to a computer we provide the MIDI Bridge. It allows high speed transport of MIDI messages between two USB hosts.</p>
        <p>A computer running a DAW or similar is the center of many setups. It functions as a USB host and can only be connected to USB devices. Since the C15 is also a USB host we provide the <q>MIDI Bridge</q> that functions as a double-sided USB device with two Type B connectors. One of the ports is connected to the C15 and the second to your computer.</p>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>For more information, please refer to the <a href="./documents/man-midi-bridge/index.html">MIDI Bridge Manual</a>.</p>
        </div>
        <h3>Internal Audio Recorder</h3>
        <p>The internal recorder enables you to capture the C15's output signal with the best possible audio quality at any time, without connecting an audio interface.</p>
        <p>From the browser-based <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Graphical">User Interface</span> you can play back the recorded audio and you can also restore the Synth Engine's state at the time of the play cursor.</p>
        <p>Selected segments of the audio can be downloaded in a lossless digital format and be used directly on your computer in your production environment.</p>
        <p>The stereo signal behind the Soft Clipper and before the D/A converter is written to the RAM, using the lossless compression of the FLAC format (24 bits, 48 kHz).</p>
        <p>A maximum of 500 MB can be stored in the RAM. Because of the FLAC compression this is enough for hours of permanent playing and for days of recording when there are pauses in the playing.</p>
        <p>If the recorded amount of data exceeds the limit of 500 MB, the oldest data will be overwritten. So it works like a ring buffer that always contains the latest recording.</p>
        <dl>
            <dt>
                <h4>Features at a glance</h4>
            </dt>
            <dd data-columns="2">
                <ul>
                    <li>Loss-free digital recording of the stereo output signal</li>
                    <li>FLAC-compressed storage of the last hours (at least 80 min) of playing</li>
                    <li>Auto-start when the C15 is booted (optional)</li>
                    <li>Visualization in the browser and play-back controls</li>
                </ul>
                <ul>
                    <li>Download of the selected segment as FLAC or WAV file</li>
                    <li>The sound parameters at any point of the timeline can be restored</li>
                    <li>Complete information about the presets used in the session</li>
                </ul>
            </dd>
        </dl>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>For more information, please refer to the User Manual, chapter <a href="./documents/man-user/06-recorder/06-recorder.html" data-number="6">Recorder</a>.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>
</body>
</html>

<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 class="heading secondary"><span class="sw-version">21-49</span> Studio Package Improvements 1</h2>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>This update addresses the newly introduced MIDI features and provides bug fixes, refinements and further enhancements.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 data-detail="Setup Menu">MIDI Settings</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <ul>
                <li>The layout and some of the labels of the MIDI Settings have been revised.</li>
                <li>In the new <q>Channels</q> section the MIDI Channels for both Send and Receive can be set.</li>
                <li>The <q>Mappings</q> section has been renamed to <q>Assignments</q>.</li>
                <li>The <q>Set to Defaults</q> entries have been moved to the <q>Assignments</q> section.</li>
                <li>The new <q>Routings</q> section cointains a matrix editor that determines for Notes, Program Changes and each of the 8 <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Hardware">Sources</span> separately, if MIDI messages are sent or received via the Primary MIDI channel or the Split channel. In the matrix you can also enable and disable the <q>Local</q> connections between the elements of the C15's play interface and the C15's sound engine.</li>
            </ul>
            <ul>
                <li>There is a global <q>Local Enable</q> in the second line of the MIDI Settings. When it is set to <q>Off</q> the Local connections of all elements are interrupted.</li>
                <li>The <q>Panic</q> entry has been moved to the first line.</li>
                <li>The former <q>Receive</q>, <q>Send</q> and <q>Local</q> sections have been removed in favor of the new approach.</li>
                <li>Correct display of CC numbers for 7-bit and 14-bit resolution in the Assignments and in the <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Ribbon"></span> labels.</li>
            </ul>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3><q>Local Off</q> for Ribbons</h3>
        <p>If a <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Ribbon"></span> is set to <q>Local Off</q> the <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Base Unit">Display</span> shows the MIDI CC that is assigned. The Ribbon LEDs show the position that is sent via MIDI.</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3>MIDI Program Change Bank</h3>
        <p>Selecting a Preset in the PC Bank will send a Program Change message also when the bank is not selected (Direct Load = Off).</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3>All Notes Off, Internal Voice Reset</h3>
        <p>More consistent behaviour when resetting the internal voices and sending a <q>All Notes Off</q> message via MIDI. This is used to avoid stuck notes when the MIDI routings or Local connections are changed.</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 data-detail="Base Unit">Panic Function</h3>
        <p>Pressing all four buttons of the <span class="keyword" data-keyword="Base">Unit</span> (<q>-</q>, <q>+</q>, <q>Funct</q>, <q>Mode</q>) at the same time will reset all internal voices and send <q>All Notes Off</q> via MIDI.</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3>WIFI Passphrase</h3>
        <p>The passphrase can now be edited and reset to the default (88888888). A <q>Randomize</q> (<q>Dice</q>) function is still available, too.</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3>Fixes and Improvements</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <ul>
                <li>in some Preset Store functions</li>
                <li>in the Backup Restore function</li>
                <li>in the New Bank function</li>
                <li>in the Bank Collapse function</li>
            </ul>
            <ul>
                <li>in the Bank Import function</li>
                <li>in the Preset screen</li>
                <li>in the Preset/Bank file format to fix a problem with Split Sound parameters</li>
            </ul>
        </div>
        <div data-highlight="warn">
            <h4>Please note</h4>
            <p>The Bank and Backup files stored with this software version cannot be loaded with earlier versions.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3>Known Issues</h3>
        <ul>
            <li>When Local is disabled, not every necessary <q>All Notes Off</q> message is sent to stop stuck notes.</li>
            <li>The button combination for <q>Panic</q> can lead to unintended changes on the base unit settings.</li>
        </ul>
    </section>
</main>
</div>

        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/change-log/index.html">Change Log</a>

<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 class="heading secondary"><span class="sw-version">22-16</span> Studio Package Improvements 2</h2>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>This update further refines newly introduced MIDI features and provides additional bug fixes and enhancements.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3>Hardware Sources</h3>
        <p>The Positions of Hardware Sources are now separated from Presets. This allows for more reliable Preset recall and store behavior, even when returning Sources are not in their return positions.</p>
        <p>However, the Return Behavior of Pedals and Ribbons remains a part of a Preset and may differ when recalling another Preset.</p>
        <div class="section">
            <h4 data-detail="Hardware UI, Graphical UI">MIDI Assignments</h4>
            <p>When a Hardware Source has a MIDI assignment, it will be indicated on the parameter <i>(for example, the CC number)</i>.</p>
        </div>
        <div class="section">
            <h4>Local On/Off Enhancements</h4>
            <p>Decoupling a Hardware Source from the synth by setting Local Enable to <code>Off</code>, changes their representation in the UI.</p>
            <div data-columns="2">
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Local On/Off on Hardware Sources">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="./images/web-ui/parameter/webui-hw-local.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <div>
                    <p>The Hardware Source is now shown differentiated into <q>Send</q> and <q>Receive</q>.</p>
                </div>
            </div>
            <p><q>Send</q> shows the physical status of the respective Hardware Source, for example the current position of a Ribbon and relates to all communication with external devices. This value is sent via MIDI.</p>
                    <p><q>Receive</q> assigns the value that is passed internally to the synth. This is either a value received via MIDI or, in the case of the bidirectional Ribbons, a value received via an adjusted Macro Control. This allows the audio engine of the C15 to be triggered by an external device and at the same time the Hardware Sources can be used to control other external devices without conflict.</p>
        </div>
        <div class="section">
            <h4>Changing a Hardware Source Return Behavior</h4>
            <p>When <code>[ReturnToZero/ReturnToCenter]</code> is chosen, the position of the Hardware Source will drop to the return position.</p>
            <div data-highlight="warn">
                <p>We recommend to leave returning Sources in their return positions when changing their Return Behavior. Otherwise, the modulation to associated Macro Controls may be compromised due to offsets and clipping Macro Controls.</p>
            </div>
            <div data-highlight="note">
                <p>If a Pedal's behavior changes <code>[ReturnToCenter &#x2192; NonReturn/ReturnToZero]</code>, the position will be clipped (negative values will be set to zero).</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="section">
            <h4>Recalling a Preset with differing Return Behavior</h4>
            <p>In case the return behavior of a particular Hardware Source changes when a preset is recalled, our general aim is to leave the position intact. However, there is an exception: If a Ribbon changes <code>[NonReturn &#x2192; ReturnToCenter]</code>, the position will drop to the return position.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3>Boot Sound</h3>
        <p>As Hardware Source positions are not part of a Preset anymore, loading the first Sound after booting the C15 depends on how the Hardware Sources are placed physically. Returning Hardware Sources may not be in their return positions, which will affect the Preset. Non-returning untouched Pedals and Ribbons are dominated by associated Macro Controls and will not affect the Preset.</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3>User Manual</h3>
        <p>The User Manual has been reworked from scratch and now provides more content and better navigation.</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3>Fixes and Improvements</h3>
        <div class="section">
            <h4>MIDI</h4>
            <p>If the Local Enable setting of a Hardware Source changes, the last position will be shared between the Send and Receive representations <i>(Local <code>On &#x2192; Off</code>: Receive &#x2192; Send, <code>Local Off &#x2192; On</code>: Send &#x2192; Receive)</i>. So, even for returning Sources in arbitrary positions, the last position will correctly be reflected.</p>
            <p>A returning Hardware Source will drop to its return position (internally, affecting the Receive representation and the Synth), when Local is disabled.</p>
            <p><code>AllNotesOff</code> messages are now sent more carefully, only if internal keys are pressed. When recalling Split Sounds with differing Mono/Unison behavior, the message will correspond to the Part in which a reset occured.</p>
        </div>
        <div class="section">
            <h4>Recorder</h4>
            <p>The Auto Start option will default to <code>Off</code>, until it is explicitly changed.</p>
        </div>
        <div class="section">
            <h4>General Fixes</h4>
            <ul>
                <li>reworked animated screens in the Panel Unit Display</li>
                <li>introduced a Shutdown Screen (urging the User to not cut the power supply until the C15 is properly shut down)</li>
                <li>fixed Bank Import from USB Stick</li>
                <li>fixed Bank sorting</li>
            </ul>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3>Known Issues</h3>
        <p>The current handling of Hardware Sources works reliably when using physical Sources or MIDI messages. Using Hardware Sources from the Hardware UI or Web UI during Behavior changes, Preset recalls or Local changes may lead to unwanted behavior.</p>
        <div data-highlight="warn">
            <p>Recalling a <code>[ReturnToCenter]</code> Pedal with negative position can cause a Modulation offset.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>
</body>

<main>
    <section>
        <h2 class="heading secondary"><span class="sw-version">22-27</span> Service Update - new Hardware Support</h2>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>Newer C15 devices (starting with serial no. <code>223</code>) contain new hardware components that require software support and are not compatible with older software versions (before <span class="sw-version">22-27</span>).</p>
        </div>
        <p>This update provides software support for new hardware components and ensures that C15 devices with new hardware components cannot be updated to earlier versions. For C15 devices with new hardware components, this update is essential. For older C15 devices, this update is optional.</p>
        <div data-highlight="warn">
            <p>We strongly recommend to not update newer C15 devices with older software versions, as the device will not be usable afterwards.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>

<body class="main-grid" data-path="root/change-log/23-05">
<!-- menu: location -->
<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/change-log/index.html">Change Log</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/change-log/23-05.html">Spring 2023 Update</a>
    </label>
</div>
<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 class="heading primary"><span class="sw-version">23-05</span> Spring 2023 Update</h2>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>The C15 gets a major update that provides lots of enhancements and new features.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3>Parameter Enhancements</h3>
        <div class="section">
            <h4>Modulateable Parameters</h4>
            <p>The number of modulateable Parameters has been increased - most Parameters are now modulateable:</p>
            <ul>
                <li><span data-keyword="Envelope">Amounts</span> (for Oscillator Phase Modulation, Filter Pitches and Cutoff)</li>
                <li><span data-keyword="Envelope">A/B/C</span> - Attack Curve (effective when a Key is pressed)</li>
                <li><span data-keyword="Pitch"></span> (3x) and <span data-keyword="Filter"></span> (5x) <span data-keyword="">Key Trackings</span></li>
                <li><span data-keyword="Shaper">Mixes</span> (for Phase Modulation) and <span data-keyword="">Fold, Asym</span> (including Shaper A/B, Feedback/Output Mixer, Cabinet)</li>
                <li><span data-keyword="Output Mixer">Pan</span></li>
                <li><span data-keyword="Effects">(Flanger, Cabinet, Gap Filter, Echo, Reverb)</span> - all Parameters</li>
                <li><span data-keyword="Scale">Offsets</span> (blending between two scalings via modulation)</li>
                <li><span data-keyword="Part">Split Point</span> - when unlinked, the parameter can now be modulated individually per Part</li>
            </ul>
            <div data-highlight="note">
                <p>The modulation mechanism has also been refined, modulated parameters now behave more consistent.</p>
                <p>Rounding issues of displayed modulation ranges (for example unstable upper/lower limits) have been removed and discrepancies between displayed and audible parameter positions (especially the <span data-keyword="Part">Split Point</span> parameter) should no longer occur.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="section">
            <h4>Parameter Ranges</h4>
            <p>Several Parameter ranges have been extended, providing more flexibility:</p>
            <ul>
                <li><span data-keyword="Envelope">A/B/C</span> - Attack/Release Velocity (now bipolar, similar to Decay 1/2 Velocity, times can be reduced or increased)</li>
                <li><span data-keyword="Pitch"></span> (3x) and <span data-keyword="Filter"></span> (3x) <span data-keyword="">Key Trackings</span> - new maximum at 200%</li>
                <li><span data-keyword="Envelope">A/B/C</span> - Time Key Tracking (now bipolar, times can be reduced or increased)</li>
                <li><span data-keyword="Shaper A/B">FB - Gate - EnvC</span> (now bipolar, allowing for permanent feedback)</li>
                <li><span data-keyword="Output Mixer">Key Pan</span> (now bipolar)</li>
                <li><span data-keyword="Unison">Detune</span> - new maximum at 24 st</li>
            </ul>
        </div>
        <div class="section" style="page-break-after: always;">
            <h4>Parameter Scaling and Rounding</h4>
            <p>Scaling and Rounding behavior has been reworked:</p>
            <ul>
                <li><span data-keyword="Scale">Offsets</span> - modified Parameter scaling (high precision for typcial +/- 100.0 ct range, spanning approximately half of the slider - lower precision for atypical +/- 1200.0 ct range)</li>
                <li>All Parameters - consistent display of values (Control Positions and Modulation Amounts) according to Parameter resolution (every Fine value has a distinct representation)</li>
            </ul>
        </div>
        <div class="section">
            <h4>Envelope C</h4>
            <ul>
                <li>Decay 1/2 Velocity - more flexible velocity influence on times (similar to <span data-keyword="Envelope">A/B</span>)</li>
                <li class="section">
                    <header style="font-weight: bold;">New: Loop</header>
                    <p>With the new Loop Parameter, <span data-keyword="Envelope">C</span> can run in Loop mode (Loop > 0.0%), allowing for polyphonic repeating sequences:</p>
                    <p>The loop consists of the Decay 1 and 2 segments (Decay 2 has a linear curve in Loop mode) and can apply only for the Sustain phase (Loop &lt;= 100.0%, stopping when a key is released) or for the Sustain and Release phase (Loop &gt; 100.0%). At Loop = 200.0%, the loop will continue endlessly.</p>
                    <p>The loop is bound to key events. When pressing a key, Envelope C will start normally if the Loop parameter is at zero, otherwise it will start in Loop mode. Similarly, when releasing a key, Envelope C will stop normally if the Loop parameter is below or equal to 100.0%, otherwise it will stop in Loop mode.</p>
                    <p>The Decay 1/2 times control the rate of the loop.</p>
                    <p>The Breakpoint/Sustain levels control the amplitude of the loop. For each repetition, the loop amplitude will approach zero, according to the Loop parameter (smaller values: faster decay).</p>
                </li>
            </ul>
        </div>
        <div class="section">
            <h4>New: Single Sounds with Dual Effects</h4>
            <p><span data-keyword="Single">Sounds</span> now provide two Effect chains, allowing for more complex routings similar to <span data-keyword="Split/Layer">Sounds</span>. The mix of the two chains can be controlled by a new parameter:</p>
            <ul style="page-break-after: always;">
                <li><span data-keyword="Master">FX Mix</span> - crossfading between Effects <span data-utf="ind-part-1"></span> and <span data-utf="ind-part-2"></span> - similar to <span data-keyword="Part">Volumes</span> in <span data-keyword="Split/Layer">Sounds</span>)</li>
            </ul>
            <div data-columns="2">
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Single Sound - indicators">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="./images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-single-new-indicators.png"></picture>
                    <picture class="content" data-src="./images/web-ui/sound/webui-snd-single-new-indicators.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <div>
                    <p>The <span data-keyword="Feedback Mixer">Effects - From I-II</span> and <span data-keyword="Output Mixer">To FX I-II</span> parameters are also available for defining the Effects and Feedback routing for both Effect chains. The routings are indicated in the <span data-keyword="Sound">Screen</span> or <span data-keyword="">Tab</span>.</p>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="section">
            <h4>New: Dual Effects/Part Mixing</h4>
            <p>Two new parameters have been added for more versatile mixing of Parts (or Effects in <span data-keyword="Single">Sounds</span>):</p>
            <ul>
                <li>
                    <header><span data-keyword="Master">Serial FX</span></header>
                    <p>Usually both Effect chains run in parallel. With this new parameter, the output of one chain can be fed into the input of the other chain, allowing for flexibility in the order of effects and their complexity.</p>
                </li>
                <li>
                    <header><span data-keyword="Master">Part/FX Pan</span></header>
                    <p>Both Effect chains can be panned against each other, more flexibly distributing their output signals in the resulting stereo mix.</p>
                </li>
            </ul>
        </div>
        <div class="section">
            <h4>New: two new virtual Ribbons</h4>
            <p><span data-keyword="Ribbon">3, 4</span> have been added to the <span data-keyword="Hardware">Sources</span> allowing for more flexible modulation and hopefully better integrating <span data-keyword="Macro">Controls</span> <span data-utf="mc-e"></span> and <span data-utf="mc-f"></span>.</p>
            <p>The two sets of <span data-keyword="Ribbons"></span> (<span data-keyword="">1, 2</span> and <span data-keyword="">3, 4</span>) are quickly accessible on the <span data-keyword="Base">Unit</span> (see below).</p>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section style="page-break-before: always;">
        <h3>User Interface Enhancements</h3>
        <div class="section">
            <h4 data-detail="Panel-Unit">Preset Screen</h4>
            <p>The behavior of <span data-keyword="Soft Button">1</span> and <span data-keyword="">4</span> has been reworked.</p>
            <div data-columns="2">
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Initialize Screen">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="./images/hardware-ui/boled/preset/boled-pre-23-04.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <div class="section">
                    <p><code><b>Bank</b></code> and <code><b>Direct Ld</b></code> now remains consistent with legacy behavior as the primary command <i>(short button press)</i>, whereas the new features (<code><b>I / II</b></code> and <code><b>To Part</b></code>) appear as the secondary command <i>(long button press)</i> if available.</p>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="section">
            <h4>Sound Conversion</h4>
            <div data-highlight="note">
                <p>With now two Effect chains in a <span data-keyword="Single">Sound</span>, a conversion into a <span data-keyword="Split"></span> or <span data-keyword="Layer">Sound</span> has new rules. In order not to break established behavior, such a conversion is possible in two variants:</p>
                <table>
                    <tr>
                        <th>with FX I only</th>
                        <th>both FX</th>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                        <td>This corresponds with legacy behavior and is useful for a typical <span data-keyword="Single">Sound</span> using only FX I. After the conversion, FX I is duplicated into both <span data-keyword="Dual">Sound</span> Effect chains.</td>
                        <td>For a <span data-keyword="Single">Sound</span> using both Effect chains, a conversion copying both chains is more useful. Here, the <span data-keyword="Master">FX Mix</span> parameter is also considered and translated into <span data-keyword="Part">Volume</span> parameters. Also, cross Feedback and FX routings are maintained.</td>
                    </tr>
                </table>
                <p>A conversion of a <span data-keyword="Dual">Sound</span> into a <span data-keyword="Single">Sound</span> will copy both Effect chains and reflect <span data-keyword="Part">Volume</span> parameters and cross Feedback and FX routings.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="section">
            <h4 data-detail="Panel Unit">Sound Initialization</h4>
            <p><p>When holding down the <span data-keyword="Default">Button</span> in the <span data-keyword="Sound"></span> or <span data-keyword="Preset">Screen</span>, the <span data-keyword="Initialize">Screen</span> will be visible.</p>
            <div data-columns="2">
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Initialize Screen">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="./images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-initialize.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <div class="section">
                    <p>Here, <span data-keyword="Soft Buttons">1,2,3</span> can be used to initialize with a desired <span data-keyword="Sound">Type</span>. In <span data-keyword="Split"></span> or <span data-keyword="Layer">Sounds</span>, <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span> can be used to initialize only the Part/FX currently in focus.</p>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="section">
            <h4 data-detail="Panel Unit">Copy FX</h4>
            <div data-columns="2">
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound Edit Screen - copy FX">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="./images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-edit-copy-fx.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <div>
                    <p>When pressing the <span data-keyword="Edit">Button</span> in the <span data-keyword="Sound">Screen</span>, two new options provide a quick way to copy the Effect chain from one Part into the other.</p>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="section">
            <h4 data-detail="Graphical UI">Preset Search</h4>
            <p>The Preset Search has been reworked from scratch and is now quickly accessible via the top-left <span data-keyword="Search">Icon</span>.</p>
            <div data-columns="2">
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset Search">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="./images/web-ui/preset/web-ui-preset-search.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <div class="section">
                    <p>The search results are now shown in a separate list and can be sorted and filtered to match specific <span data-keyword="Banks"></span> or <span data-keyword="Color">Tags</span>.</p>
                    <p>Presets can be loaded directly from the list. In addition, Presets can be dragged and dropped into new or existing Banks.</p>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="section">
            <h4 data-detail="Graphical UI">Fine Mode</h4>
            <p>In the <span data-keyword="Parameter">Tab</span>, a new icon shows if the <span data-keyword="Fine">Mode</span> is active (when pressing the <kbd>Shift</kbd> key). The Fine Mode can also be enabled permanently by clicking the icon (and will stay enabled as long as the selected Parameter has a Fine Resolution).</p>
        </div>
        <div class="section" style="page-break-after: always;">
            <h4 data-detail="Panel Unit">Scale Parameter Screen</h4>
            <div data-columns="2">
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Scale Screen">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="./images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-parameter-scale-screen.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <div>
                    <p>A new Screen has been added to better show Scale parameters. It can be accessed from the Master Parameter Screen.</p>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="section">
            <h4 data-detail="Panel Unit">Hardware Source and Macro Control Screens</h4>
            <p>Routing <span data-keyword="Hardware">Sources</span> to <span data-keyword="Macro">Controls</span> has been more complex than it needed to be, possibly causing some confusion when trying to modify the <span data-keyword="Modulation">Matrix</span>. Also, with the two new <span data-keyword="Ribbons">Ribbons</span>, there are two more amounts to consider. Therefore, setting <span data-keyword="Hardware">Amounts</span> has been simplified, deprecating the <span data-keyword="Hardware Amount">Screen</span> and bundling all functionality exclusively within the <span data-keyword="Macro Control">Screen</span>.</p>
            <div data-columns="2">
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Macro Control Screen">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="./images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-mc-22-51.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <div>
                    <p>By using <span data-keyword="Soft Buttons">2</span> and <span data-keyword="">4</span>, <span data-keyword="Hardware">Amounts</span> can be set for the <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span> in focus.</p>
                </div>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Hardware Source Screen">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="./images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-hw-22-51.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <div>
                    <p>In the <span data-keyword="Hardware Source">Screen</span>, all related parameter aspects can be changed.</p>
                </div>
            </div>
            <div data-highlight="note">
                <p><span data-keyword="MIDI">Assignments</span> are shown on the left (and can be changed via Setup MIDI settings). For <span data-keyword="Ribbons"></span>, their <span data-keyword="Touch">Behavior</span> can be modified via <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span> (previously only available via the <span data-keyword="Funct">Button</span> on the <span data-keyword="Base">Unit</span>).</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="section">
            <h4 data-detail="Base Unit">Changed Functionality</h4>
            <p>When in <span data-keyword="Play">Mode</span>, the <span data-keyword="Funct">Button</span> will now switch between the two sets of <span data-keyword="Ribbons"></span> (<span data-keyword="">1/2</span> or <span data-keyword="">3/4</span>) - the selected set is then operable on the two touch strips.</p>
            <div data-highlight="note">
                <p>Ribbon <span data-keyword="Touch">Behavior</span> can now be changed in the corresponding <span data-keyword="Parameter">Screen</span> on the <span data-keyword="Panel">Unit</span>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3>Additional Fixes</h3>
        <ul>
            <li>
                <header>Importing older Banks converted some parameters wrongfully</header>
                <p>Affected Parameters were: <span data-keyword="Envelope A/B/C">Attack Velocity</span> and <span data-keyword="">Time Key Tracking</span>, <span data-keyword="Shaper A/B">Feedback - Env C</span> and <span data-keyword="Output Mixer">Key Pan</span>.</p>
            </li>
            <li style="page-break-before: always;">
                <header><span data-keyword="Recorder"></span></header>
                <p>When closing the <span data-keyword="Recorder">Tab</span> in the browser, the playback will stop automatically.</p>
            </li>
            <li>
                <header><span data-keyword="Part">Selection</span></header>
                <p>Selecting a <span data-keyword="Part"></span> (or <span data-keyword="FX">Group</span> in <span data-keyword="Single">Sounds</span>) is now undoable.</p>
            </li>
            <li>
                <header><span data-keyword="Envelope A/B/C">Attack Curvature</span></header>
                <p>The Parameters are now applied for each voice. When the Parameter changes within the Attack segment of a played node, the change will not apply for the active voice.</p>
            </li>
            <li>
                <header>Wrong <span data-keyword="Envelope C">Decay 1/2</span> times</header>
                <p>In earlier versions, <span data-keyword="Envelope C">Decay 1/2</span> times were wrongfully influenced by <span data-keyword="Envelope B">Decay 1/2 Velocity</span> parameters.</p>
            </li>
            <li>
                <header>Voice Mixing in <span data-keyword="Single">Sounds</span> is now consistent</header>
                <p>All 24 voices are now mixed and unambiguously routed to a specific <span data-keyword="FX">Group</span>.</p>
            </li>
        </ul>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3>Known limitations and issues</h3>
        <div class="section">
            <h4>Preset Search - drag and drop on touch devices</h4>
            <p>When dragging one or multiple presets from the search results list and dropping the selection (into an existing bank or onto the background to create a new bank), the selection may not be released correctly and remains stuck on the screen as a visual bug, freezing the <span data-keyword="Graphical">UI</span>. After refreshing the page, the UI will be usable again.</p>
        </div>
        <div class="section">
            <h4>Audible artifacts of modulated Parameters</h4>
            <p>With the introduction of more modulateable Parameters, some audible artifacts may appear when some parameters are transitioning (the issue is not really new, but modulation increases the chance of noticing the artifacts).</p>
            <p style="page-break-before: always;">The rendering of these movements is often not computed in audio rate (as a means of not wasting CPU power), leading to the described artifacts. Affected Parameters are:</p>
            <ul>
                <li><span data-keyword="Oscillator">A/B</span>: Phase Modulation - Envelope and Shaper Amounts</li>
                <li><span data-keyword="Shaper">A/B</span>: Drive Envelope Amount and FB - Gate - EnvC.</li>
                <li><span data-keyword="Comb Filter"></span>, <span data-keyword="State Variable Filter"></span>: PM/FM A-B</li>
                <li><span data-keyword="Flanger"></span>: Phase, Envelope</li>
                <li><span data-keyword="Cabinet"></span>: Fold, Asymetry</li>
                <li><span data-keyword="Reverb"></span>: Pre Delay</li>
            </ul>
        </div>
        <div class="section">
            <h4>Audible artifacts of Envelope C modulation</h4>
            <p>Similar to the phenomenon described above, Envelope C modulation can also lead to artifacts (especially when using very small Decay 1/2 times).</p>
            <p>The State Variable Filter Cutoff also seems to produce artifacts when strongly modulated by Envelope C.</p>
        </div>
        <div class="section">
            <h4>Feedback/FX flow indicators</h4>
            <p>The combination of shown volumes and flow arrows is a little misleading, as a volume is applied at the end of the flow chain, but appears to be at the start.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>
</body>
</html>

        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/change-log/index.html">Change Log</a>

        <a href="./documents/change-log/23-12.html">Spring Update Improvements 1</a>
    </label>
