<!-- menu: location -->
<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html">User Manual</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/03-basic-concepts/03-00-0-basic-concepts.html" data-number="3">Basic Concepts</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/03-basic-concepts/03-08-undo.html" data-number="3.8">The Undo Tree</a>
    </label>
</div>
<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="3.8">The Undo Tree</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <div class="section" data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Undo (list-based)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="./images/info-gfk/gfk-undo-list-*.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The usual undo history of a program would be a list-like data structure. When an editing action is tracked, it is simply appended to the list. If you undo a number of edits, they are lost when when you make new edits.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Undo (tree-based)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="./images/info-gfk/gfk-undo-tree-*.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The C15's undo history, on the other hand, is a tree-like data structure. All editing actions are tracked and new branches are created when you undo edits and then make new changes.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <p>Using this mechanism, there will be no loss of editing steps, as all steps and branches are accessible. Nevertheless, an ever-growing undo tree will require lots of memory and may be capable of slowing down the system. This can be avoided by making a certain element the new root of the tree (elements prior to that position will be lost in this case) or by deleting inactive branches of the undo tree.</p>
        <p>Within a branch, the mechanism is quite similar to the ordinary list-based undo, providing backward and forward navigation via undo or redo. The extended tree-based functionalities emerge when navigating to other branches.</p>
        <p>The C15 undo mechanism tracks different user actions. Parameter selection, edits to parameters, preset recalls and edits to presets and banks can be undone. However, the modulation mechanism is not integrated into the undo mechanism, as it is part of the user performance.</p>
    </section>
</main>
</div>
</body>
</html>

<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4">User Interfaces</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <p>As described, the C15 has two different user interfaces. The <span data-keyword="Hardware"> User Interface</span> consists of the <span data-keyword="Base"> Unit</span> and <span data-keyword="Panel"> Unit</span> with their haptic ("hands on") controls.</p>
        <p>The <span data-keyword="Graphical"> User Interface</span> is available on external devices via a Wi-Fi connection, and offers a detailed representation of all parameters and presets. Multiple devices can be connected in parallel, each focused on different aspects.</p>
        <figure class="border maximize" data-label="User Interfaces">
            <picture class="content" data-src="images/info-gfk/gfk-user-interfaces-*.png"></picture>
        </figure>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>Note that all available interfaces operate in a synchronized manner, sharing the same state and focus.</p>
        </div>
        <p>The following chapters explain how to focus on items and their aspects to edit them.</p>
    </section>
</main>
</div>
</body>
</html>

<!-- menu: location -->
<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html">User Manual</a>

        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-00-user-interfaces.html" data-number="4">User Interfaces</a>

        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-01-parameter-organization.html" data-number="4.1">Parameter Organization</a>
    </label>

<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.1">Parameter Organization</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <!-- <p>This chapter describes new features that where introduced on version <span class="sw-version">20-28</span>.</p> -->
        <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Parameter Organization">
            <picture class="content" data-src="images/info-gfk/gfk-param-orga-*.png"></picture>
        </figure>
        <p><span class="round">1</span> The <span data-keyword="Hardware"> Sources</span>, their Amounts, <span data-keyword="Macro"> Controls</span>, Master and Scale parameters are considered global and are present only once within a Preset, regardless of the <span data-keyword="Sound"> Type</span> (Single, Split, Layer).</p>
        <p><span class="round">2</span> Most parameters (from Envelope A up to Reverb) are considered local and are present once for <span data-keyword="Single"></span> Presets or twice within a <span data-keyword="Split"></span> or <span data-keyword="Layer"></span> Preset.</p>
        <p>A few new parameters of the <span class="round">3</span> Feedback and <span class="round">4</span> Output Mixer are special, as they only are present, if the current Sound type is not Single (the new <span class="round">3</span> Feedback parameters are only available if the Sound type is Layer).</p>
        <p><span class="round">5</span> The Voices group consists of the Unison and new Mono parameters. The Voices group is present once within a Single or Layer Preset and twice within a Split Preset.</p>
        <p><span class="round">6</span> The Part group consists of the Part Volume/Tune parameters as well as the Split Point (Split Presets) or the Fade From and Fade Range (Layer Presets) parameters. The group is only available, when the Sound type is not Single.</p>
        <p>When a Single Sound (referred to as <q>Source</q>) is converted to a Split or Layer Sound (referred to as <q>Target</q>), global Parameters are copied entirely. The Source’s Master Volume and Tune will be delegated to Target’s Part Volume and Tune. The Source’s local Parameters will be transferred to both Parts of the Target. The Source’s Voices Parameters will be transferred globally if the Target is of type Layer. If the Target is of type Split, the Source’s Voices Parameters will be transferred to both Target Parts. Should the Source possess Unison Voices greater than 12, they will be clipped to 12.</p>
        <p>In general, any Sound type can be converted to any other type. In addition, Single Presets and selected Parts of Split or Layer Presets can be loaded to selected Parts of Split or Layer Sounds. The particular transfer of Parameters strongly depends on the specific scenario and will be described in more detail in the future.</p>
        <p>When a Preset is loaded into one of the Parts this will not change global parameters like the mapping of the Hardware Sources or the positions or names of the Macro Controls. Parameters assigned to Macro Controls of the new Preset will be connected to the existing Macro Controls. You need to check if this assignment works for both Parts. It may be necessary to reassign the parameters to other Macro Controls.</p>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>Note, that when you select a Macro Control, only the modulation targets in the currently selected Part are highlighted.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>
</body>

<body class="main-grid" data-path="root/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-02-selection">
<!-- menu: location -->
<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html">User Manual</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-00-user-interfaces.html" data-number="4">User Interfaces</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-02-selection.html" data-number="4.2">Selection</a>
    </label>
</div><!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.2">Selection</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <p>The C15's architecture was designed to offer quick access to all items and aspects, with one central area representing the current focus. This main principle (of focussing on one item at a time for editing) affects each interaction on any available user interface. As mentioned, the current focus will be shared with all involved devices.</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Selection</h3>
        <div class="section" data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Parameter Selection Buttons">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/info-gfk/gfk-param-panels-*.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p><span data-keyword="Parameter"> Panels</span> provide <span data-keyword="Parameter"> Selection Buttons</span>. The corresponding LED (left of the button) lights up to indicate the current focus.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Multiple Parameters">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/multiple-params.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Multiple parameters can be selected with a single <span data-keyword="Parameter"> Selection Buttons</span> (indicated by circles below the LED).</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="(Multiple) Parameter Stack">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/mp-sb4-param.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The <span data-keyword="Parameter"> Selection Buttons</span> or <span data-keyword="Soft"> Button 4</span> allows you to cycle through the stack.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound Screen Parameters">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/mp-sound.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The <span data-keyword="Sound"> Button</span> provides access to the few parameter groups that are not directly accessible on the Parameter Panels.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <p><span data-keyword="Soft"> Button 4</span> redirects to the Master group, <span data-keyword="Soft"> Button 3</span> to the Unison and Mono groups. In Split and Layer Sounds, <span data-keyword="Soft"> Button 2</span> redirects to the Part group, and <span data-keyword="Soft"> Button 1</span> is available in many screens in order to change the Part in focus.</p>
        <div class="section" data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Macro Controls">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/macro-group-panel.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The <span data-keyword="Macro"> Controls</span> are shown as a distinct group. Pressing a <span data-keyword="Parameter"> Selection Button</span> twice redirects to the <span data-keyword="Hardware"> Sources</span>.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Panel Unit Display">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/midpanel.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The <span data-keyword="Panel"> Unit Display</span> provides a corresponding screen for the selected item. The buttons of the <span data-keyword="Edit"> Panel</span> give access to all aspects of the items.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Selection</h3>
        <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Parameters (Graphical UI)">
            <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-param-editor.png"></picture>
        </figure>
        <p>All parameters are shown in the main area and can be selected by clicking on them.</p>
            <div class="section" data-columns="2">
                <div> 
                    <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Part A (Graphical UI)">
                        <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-split-layer-p1.png"></picture>
                    </figure>
                    <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Part B (Graphical UI)">
                        <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-split-layer-p2.png"></picture>
                    </figure>
                </div>
                <div>
                    <p>In Split and Layer Sounds there is a colored frame around the main area including an indicator for the selected Part.</p>    
                </div>
            </div>
        <p>A touch/click on the indicator opens the parameters of the other Part. (The <span data-keyword="Hardware"> User Interface</span> has its own Part focus and will not reflect selections in the <span data-keyword="Graphical"> User Interface</span>, unless it is deliberately enabled in the <span data-keyword="Setup"> Menu</span>.)</p>
        <div class="section" data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Selected Parameters (Graphical UI)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-param-selected.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The background of an element highlights to indicate that it has been selected. Use the mouse wheel or pinch gestures on the main area background to zoom into the provided map.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <p>A double click on a <span data-keyword="Parameter"> Group</span> header zooms into the group. Different details emerge depending on the zoom level. High priority parameters are always visible.</p>
        <div class="section" data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Modulation Matrix (Graphical UI)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-hw-src-group.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p><span data-keyword="Macro"> Controls</span> and <span data-keyword="Hardware"> Sources</span> appear as separate groups in the main area, providing all related aspects.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Tab Area (Graphical UI)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-tabs.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The expandable tab area shows all item-related aspects. Parameters can be edited in the <span data-keyword="Parameter"> Tab</span>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <p>Chapters <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-03-1-parameter-editing.html" data-number="4.3">Parameters</a> to <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-06-0-presets.html" data-number="4.6">Presets</a> detail selected parameter- or preset-related items. Further (menu-related) items and access to them will be explained in chapters <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-07-0-sound-manipulation.html" data-number="4.7">Sound Manipulation</a> to <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-16-0-graphical-ui-functionality.html" data-number="4.16">Graphical UI Functionality</a>.</p>
    </section>
</main>
</div>

<!-- menu: location -->
<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html">User Manual</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-00-user-interfaces.html" data-number="4">User Interfaces</a>

<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.3.1">Editing a Parameter</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Adjust Control Position, coarse</h3>
        <div class="section" data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Encoder, Dec/Inc Buttons">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/mp-enc-dec-inc.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>Use the <span data-keyword="Encoder"></span> to adjust the current parameter.</p>
                <p>Use the <span data-keyword="Dec"></span> and <span data-keyword="Inc"></span> buttons to make stepwise adjustments.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Base Unit">Adjust Control Position, coarse</h3>
        <div class="section" data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Ribbon 1 Edit Mode">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/soled-ribbon-edit-mode.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>Use the <span data-keyword="Mode">Button</span> to set <span data-keyword="Ribbon">1</span> to <span data-keyword="Edit">Mode</span>. The display and the touch strip of Ribbon 1 represent the current parameter, while <span data-keyword="Ribbon">2</span> still operates in <span data-keyword="Play">Mode</span>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Adjust Control Position, coarse</h3>
        <div class="section" data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Parameter Tab - slider">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-param-adjust.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>If the external device has a mouse or touch screen display, use drag gestures to adjust the current parameter. (Use the <span data-keyword="Parameter">Tab</span> slider or main area element, if the GUI settings allow you to do so.)</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="K, M keys">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/info-gfk/gfk-tast-km.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>If the external device has a keyboard, you can use the <code>K</code> and <code>M</code> keys to make stepwise adjustments (K to increment, M to decrement).</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Mouse Wheel">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/info-gfk/gfk-tast-rad.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>If the external device has a mouse, you can also use the mouse wheel to make adjustments when the cursor is hovering over the slider in the <span data-keyword="Parameter">Tab</span>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Adjust Control Position, fine</h3>
        <div class="section" data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Fine Button">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/mp-fine.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>The <span data-keyword="Fine">Button</span> toggles adjustments to high resolution mode. An <code>F</code> will display in the parameter screen. Fine mode is normally deactivated when you change focus to a different parameter. However, Fine mode can be enabled permanently by holding down the <span data-keyword="Shift">Button</span> when you press the Fine Button. Fine will now stay active until you press the Fine Button again.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Adjust Control Position, fine</h3>
        <div class="section" data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Shift key">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/info-gfk/gfk-tast-shift.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>Hold down the Shift key to make parameter adjustments in high resolution mode.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Pinch gesture on slider">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-param-adjust-fine.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>On the slider in the <span data-keyword="Parameter">Tab</span>, you can use a pinch gesture (holding one finger while dragging another) to make high resolution adjustments.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Reset Control Position</h3>
        <div class="section" data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Default Button">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/mp-def.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>Press the <span data-keyword="Default">Button</span> to toggle between the selected parameter’s default and current value.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Reset Control Position</h3>
        <p>Double click on the element in the main area (if the GUI settings allow for it) or the slider in the <span data-keyword="Parameter">Tab</span> to toggle between the selected parameter’s default and current value.</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Control Position Edges</h3>
        <div class="section" data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Shift + Dec/Inc Buttons">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/mp-dec-inc-shift.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>Hold the <span data-keyword="Shift">Button</span> and press the <span data-keyword="Dec">Button</span> for the minimum or the <span data-keyword="Inc">Button</span> for the maximum value.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>

<!-- menu: location -->
<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html">User Manual</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-00-user-interfaces.html" data-number="4">User Interfaces</a>

        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-03-0-parameters.html" data-number="4.3">Parameters</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-03-2-parameter-modulation.html" data-number="4.3.2">Editing the Modulation of a Parameter</a>

<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.3.2">Editing the Modulation of a Parameter</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Focus on Modulation Aspects</h3>
        <div class="section" data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Soft Buttons">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/mp-sb-param.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>By default, the parameter’s control position is in focus, and <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span> can be used to cycle through the stack if there is one.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <p><span data-keyword="Soft Button">2</span> can be used to make a <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span> assignment to the parameter. If a Macro Control is assigned, <span data-keyword="Soft Button">1</span> and <span data-keyword="Soft Button">3</span> are also enabled. When you focus on a modulation aspect, <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span> is also available to enable you to access every modulation aspect. Furthermore, the <span data-keyword="Panel Unit">Display</span> now displays all modulation aspects. Press <span data-keyword="Soft Button">1</span>, <span data-keyword="">2</span> or <span data-keyword="">3</span> twice to set the focus back to the parameter’s control position.</p>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Focus on Modulation Aspects</h3>
        <div class="section" data-columns="1">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Modulation icon">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-edit-mod-tabs.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>In the <span data-keyword="Parameter">Tab</span>, you can click on the <span data-keyword="Modulation">Icon</span> to toggle the focus on modulation aspects (if a <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span> is assigned, all aspects are available). The horizontal slider represents the aspect in focus (or the control position, by default). Elements in the main area and the parameter shown in the <span data-keyword="Parameter">Tab</span> display their modulation aspects.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>Chapter <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-04-0-macro-controls.html" data-number="4.4">Macro Controls</a> explains the <span data-keyword="Fast">Mapping</span> mechanism. This provides a quick way of assigning target parameters to <span data-keyword="Macro">Controls</span>.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">MC Selector</h3>
        <div class="section" data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="MC Selector (Soft Button 2)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-param-mc-select.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>Press <span data-keyword="Soft Button">2</span> to focus on <span data-keyword="MC">Selector</span> and change the assignment like adjusting a parameter. Either none (-) or Macro Control (&#xE100;, ..., &#xE105;) can be assigned.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">MC Selector</h3>
        <div class="section" data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="MC Selector (Parameter Tab)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-param-mc-select.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>Change the current MC assignment by pressing any of the six provided assignment icons (&#xE100;, ..., &#xE105;). Click twice on an icon to clear the assignment. This aspect will not be in focus on the slider.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">MC Position</h3>
        <div class="section" data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="MC Position (Soft Button 1)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-param-mc-pos.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>Press <span data-keyword="Soft Button">1</span> to focus on <span data-keyword="MC">Position</span> and adjust it like a parameter.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">MC Position</h3>
        <div class="section" data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="MC Position icon (Parameter Tab)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-mc-pos-icon.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>Click on the MC position icon to focus on <span data-keyword="MC">Position</span> and adjust it like a parameter on the slider.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>This will cause a modulation and may affect other parameters as well. </p>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">MC Amount</h3>
        <div class="section" data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="MC Amount (Soft Button 3)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-param-mc-amt.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>Press <span data-keyword="Soft Button">3</span> to focus on <span data-keyword="MC">Amount</span> and adjust it like a parameter. The modulation range is indicated separately next to the slider.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">MC Amount</h3>
        <div class="section" data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="MC Amount icon (Parameter Tab)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-mc-amt-icon.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>Click on the MC amount icon to focus on <span data-keyword="MC">Amount</span> and adjust it like a parameter on the slider. The modulation range is indicated separately, next to the slider and on the main area element.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Modulation Range Aspects</h3>
        <div class="section" data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Modulation Aspect stack (Soft Button 4)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-param-mod-range.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>Pressing <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span> moves the focus to the rightmost stack of modulation range aspects and cycles through it. The selected aspect can be adjusted like a parameter. The following aspects are provided: the modulation range <span data-keyword="Upper">Limit</span>, the (current) control position and the modulation range <span data-keyword="Lower">Limit</span>. If the upper or lower limit exceeds the range of the parameter, clipping is indicated by an exclamation mark.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Modulation Range Aspects</h3>
        <div class="section" data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Modulation Limit icons (Parameter Tab)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-mc-limit-icons.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>Click on the <span data-keyword="Lower">Limit</span> or <span data-keyword="Upper">Limit</span> icon to focus on the modulation range aspect and change it like adjusting a parameter on the slider. The control position is in focus when no aspect is selected. If the upper or lower limit exceeds the range of the parameter, clipping is indicated by an exclamation mark.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>These aspects are logically interconnected. Changing one will affect another. </p>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>

<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.4">Macro Controls</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <p>As described, <span data-keyword="Macro">Controls</span> can modulate specific target parameters. The most common way of using Macro Controls is to play the <span data-keyword="Hardware">Sources</span>, applying modulation during a performance.</p>
        <p>When a Macro Control changes, all associated target parameters will start a transition to the modulated value, as specified by the <span data-keyword="Macro Control">Smoothing Time</span> <i>(a separate parameter for each Macro Control, <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-04-2-macro-properties.html" data-number="4.4.2">Macro Control Properties</a>)</i>.</p>
    </section>
</main>
</div>

<body class="main-grid" data-path="root/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-04-macro-controls/04-04-1-editing">
<!-- menu: location -->
<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html">User Manual</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-00-user-interfaces.html" data-number="4">User Interfaces</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-04-0-macro-controls.html" data-number="4.4">Macro Controls</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-04-1-macro-editing.html" data-number="4.4.1">Editing a Macro Control</a>
    </label>
</div>
<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.4.1">Editing a Macro Control</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Ribbons in Play Mode</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Ribbons in Play Mode">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/soled-ribbon-play-mc.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>In <span data-keyword="Play">Mode</span>, you can play the <span data-keyword="Ribbons"></span> which have been assigned to <span data-keyword="Macro Controls"></span>. Use the <span data-keyword="Mode">Button</span> to switch between modes.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Adjust Macro Control Position</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Parameter adjustment controls">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/mp-fine-def-dec-enc.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Adjust the selected <span data-keyword="Macro Control"></span> position like adjusting a parameter.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Base Unit">Adjust Macro Control Position</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Ribbon 1 in Edit Mode">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/soled-ribbon-edit-mc.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>In <span data-keyword="Edit">Mode</span>, <span data-keyword="Ribbon">1</span> can be used to edit the selected <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span>. Use the <span data-keyword="Mode">Button</span> to switch between modes.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Adjust Macro Control Position</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Parameter adjustment in Parameter Tab">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-mc-pos-adjust.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The <span data-keyword="Parameter">Tab</span> provides all parameter aspects of the selected <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span>. Adjust its position like adjusting a parameter on the slider.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary" data-detail="Panel Unit only">Fast Mapping</h3>
        <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Fast Mapping">
            <picture class="content" data-src="images/info-gfk/gfk-fastmap.png"></picture>
        </figure>
        <p>Press the <span data-keyword="Parameter">Selection Button</span> for a potential target parameter while holding down the <span data-keyword="Parameter">Selection Button</span> for a <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span> to switch the assignment on or off. This only works for target parameters at the top of the stack.</p>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>This method only handles the actual mapping of target parameters to a <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span>. Modulation amounts can only be adjusted by focussing on each parameter. However, the modulation amounts are kept, and the last value they were adjusted to is recalled.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>
</body>

<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.4.2">Macro Control Properties</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <p><span data-keyword="Macro Controls"></span> possess several properties, defining the control's appearance and behavior. They are either represented as context menu options, or as additional parameters.</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Editing Macro Control Properties</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Property stack (Soft Button 4)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-mc-focus-prop.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Press the <span data-keyword="Edit">Button</span> to focus on the properties, which are held in the stack at the right. Use <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span> to cycle through the stack. Press the <span data-keyword="Enter">Button</span> to focus on a selected property.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Editing Macro Control Properties</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Property menu (Parameter Tab)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-ctx-mc-prop-menu.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>You can click on a menu icon in the <span data-keyword="Parameter">Tab</span>. In the main area, right click on a <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span> element to call up a context menu and access its properties.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Rename and edit Macro Control Info</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Rename Screen">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-mc-rename-edit-info.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The <span data-keyword="Rename">Screen</span> allows you to edit the label and info text of the selected <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span>. <span data-keyword="Soft Button">1</span> cancels the process, <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span> or the <span data-keyword="Enter">Button</span> confirms and applies the edit (see chapter <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-12-rename-mechanism.html" data-number="4.12.">The Rename Mechanism</a> for details).</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Rename and edit Macro Control Info</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Macro Rename dialog">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-dia-mc-rename.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>A rename dialogue appears when clicking on the <q>Rename ...</q> option in a context menu, and you can edit the label with your mouse and keyboard.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Macro Info dialog">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-dia-mc-info.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The <span data-keyword="Parameter">Info</span> window appears when clicking on the <q>Parameter Info ...</q> option in a context menu, and you can edit the label as well as the info text with your mouse and keyboard.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Adjust Macro Control Smoothing Time</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <div>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Macro Smoothing Time (Soft Button 3)">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-mc-smooth-more.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Macro Smoothing Time (Soft Button 3)">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-mc-smooth-back.png"></picture>
                </figure>
            </div>
            <div>
                <p>When a <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span> is in focus, <span data-keyword="Soft Button">3</span> (<code>more..</code>) shifts the focus to its <span data-keyword="Smoothing">Time</span>, which determines how fast assigned parameters will respond to movements of the Macro Control. Adjust the time like editing a parameter. Pressing <span data-keyword="Soft Button">3</span> (<code>back..</code>) a second time will shift the focus back to the Macro Control.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Adjust Macro Control Smoothing Time</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Macro Smoothing Parameters">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-mc-group-smoothing.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Below each <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span>, its <span data-keyword="Smoothing">Time</span> is shown as a separate parameter.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Mod Reset (clear Target Assignments)</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Mod Reset (Soft Button 2)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-mc-mod-reset.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When the <span data-keyword="Smoothing">Time</span> of a <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span> is in focus, <span data-keyword="Soft Button">2</span> (<code>Mod Reset</code>) is also available. Press it and then confirm by pressing the <span data-keyword="Enter">Button</span> and the target parameter assignments of the selected Macro Control will be reset.
                </p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Mod Reset (clear Target Assignments)</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Mod Reset option">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-ctx-mc-prop-menu-mod-reset.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Click the <q>Mod Reset</q> option in a context menu and the target parameter assignments of the selected <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span> will be reset.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>

<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.4.3">Assigning a Macro Control to Hardware Sources</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Focus on Assignment Aspects</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Hardware Source assignments (Soft Buttons)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-mc.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>By default, the <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span> position is in focus. The rightmost stack indicates the influence of each <span data-keyword="Hardware">Source</span> on the Macro Control. Use <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span> to cycle through the stack or press <span data-keyword="Soft Button">2</span> in order to select a particular Hardware Source like adjusting a parameter.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <p>Once a Hardware Source is selected, <span data-keyword="Soft Buttons">1</span> and <span data-keyword>3</span> will also be available, now providing all involved assignment aspects. When <span data-keyword="Ribbon">1</span> is in <span data-keyword="Edit">Mode</span>, the selected aspect can be edited there as well (but the aspect can only be selected on the <span data-keyword="Panel">Unit</span>).</p>
        <p>Pressing <span data-keyword="Soft Button">1</span>, <span data-keyword>2</span> or <span data-keyword>3</span> a second time will return to the default focus.</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">HW Source Position</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Hardware Source position (Soft Button 1)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-mc-hw-pos.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Press <span data-keyword="Soft Button">1</span> to focus on the current <span data-keyword="Hardware">Source</span> and adjust its position like a parameter.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>This will cause a modulation and may affect other <span data-keyword="Macro">Controls</span> and parameters as well.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">HW Source Selector</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Hardware Source selector (Soft Button 2)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-mc-hw-sel.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Press <span data-keyword="Soft Button">2</span> to focus on the <span data-keyword="Hardware">Source</span> selector. Use the selector like a parameter to select any of the eight Hardware Sources.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">HW Source Amount</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Hardware Source amount (Soft Button 3)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-mc-hw-amt.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Press <span data-keyword="Soft Button">3</span> to focus on the amount of the current <span data-keyword="Hardware">Source</span> on the selected <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span>. Adjust the amount like a parameter.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">HW Source Selection Stack</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Hardware Source stack (Soft Button 4)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-mc-hw-sel-stack.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Pressing <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span> focusses on the rightmost stack of <span data-keyword="Hardware">Sources</span> and cycles through it. The eight sliders indicate the amounts of each Hardware Source on the selected <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span>. The selected element in the stack represents the corresponding amount and can be adjusted like a parameter.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Gaphical UI">Access to Assignment Aspects</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Hardware Sources and Amounts">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-hw-src-amt.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The top-center parameter group <q>Hardware Sources and Amounts</q> provides access to all <span data-keyword="Hardware">Sources</span> and their amounts on <span data-keyword="Macro">Controls</span>, represented as a modulation matrix. Items of interest can be selected and adjusted like parameters.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>

<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.5">Hardware Sources</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <p>The most common way to use <span data-keyword="Hardware">Sources</span> is to apply modulation during performance: the movements of the Hardware Sources are distributed to the target parameters by the <span data-keyword="Macro">Controls</span>.</p>
        <p>However, Hardware Sources can also be used like ordinary parameters. Keep in mind that using the Hardware Sources causes modulation and potentially affects Macro Controls and target parameters.</p>
    </section>
</main>
</div>

<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.5.1">Editing a Hardware Source</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Adjust Hardware Source Position</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Hardware Source Position">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-hw-adjust-src-pos.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Adjust the position of the selected <span data-keyword="Hardware Source"></span> like adjusting a parameter. Using a Hardware Source has the same effect as editing the value in the display.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Base Unit">Adjust Hardware Source Position</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Ribbon 1 in Edit Mode">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/soled-ribbon-edit-hw.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>In <span data-keyword="Edit">Mode</span>, <span data-keyword="Ribbon">1</span> can be used to edit the selected <span data-keyword="Hardware">Source</span>. Use the <span data-keyword="Mode">Button</span> to switch between modes.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>This will cause a modulation and may affect <span data-keyword="Macro Controls"></span> and target parameters. The source’s <span data-keyword="Return">Behavior</span> will be simulated when the screen changes, as indicated by an exclamation mark next to the value in the display.</p>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Gaphical UI">Adjust Hardware Source Position</h3>
        <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Hardware Source slider (Parameter Tab)">
            <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-hw-adjust-src-pos.png"></picture>
        </figure>
        <p>The <span data-keyword="Parameter">Tab</span> provides all parameter aspects of the selected <span data-keyword="Hardware">Source</span>. Adjust the position like a parameter.</p>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>This will cause a modulation and may affect <span data-keyword="Macro">Controls</span> and target parameters. The source’s <span data-keyword="Return">Behavior</span> will be simulated when you release the element.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>

<body class="main-grid" data-path="root/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-05-hardware-sources/04-05-2-properties">
<!-- menu: location -->
<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html">User Manual</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-00-user-interfaces.html" data-number="4">User Interfaces</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-05-0-hardware-sources.html" data-number="4.5">Hardware Sources</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-05-2-hw-properties.html" data-number="4.5.2">Hardware Source Properties</a>
    </label>
</div>
<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.5.2">Hardware Source Properties</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <p><span data-keyword="Hardware">Sources</span> possess one additional property called <span data-keyword="Return">Behavior</span>, reflecting how a source behaves when it is released (either returning to a neutral position or staying where it is).</p>
        <p>For the <span data-keyword="Bender"></span> and <span data-keyword="Aftertouch"></span>, the return behavior is fixed, as they always return mechanically. For <span data-keyword="Pedals"></span> and <span data-keyword="Ribbons"></span>, the behavior can be chosen.</p>
        <p>The Return Behavior determines how Hardware Sources affect <span data-keyword="Macro">Controls</span>. For returning sources, the corresponding amounts can be set continuously. The amounts of non-returning sources will behave like switches, either enabling or disabling full-range modulations on Macro Controls. <i>(The amount can not be negative in this case.)</i></p>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>The return behavior of <span data-keyword="Pedals"></span> should match how the corresponding external pedal controller behaves when released.</p>
        </div>
        <p>Non-returning <span data-keyword="Ribbons"></span> can only affect one <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span> exclusively and will be linked to it, meaning that both Ribbon and Macro Control will act essentially as one parameter (changes to either element will be reflected in both).</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Edit Return Behavior</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Hardware Source return behavior (Soft Button 2)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-hw-edit-behav.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>By default, the <span data-keyword="Hardware">Source</span> position is in focus. Press <span data-keyword="Soft Button">2</span> in order to focus on the return behavior and adjust it like a parameter. Press the button again in order to return to the default focus.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Edit Return Behavior</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Hardware Source return behavior (menu)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-ctx-hw-return-main.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>In the main area, right click on a <span data-keyword="Hardware">Source</span> element to call up a context menu in order to change the <span data-keyword="Return">Behavior</span>.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Hardware Source return behavior (menu)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-ctx-hw-return-tab.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>In the <span data-keyword="Parameter">Tab</span>, the menu icon provides a context menu, providing available <span data-keyword="Return">Behaviors</span> for the selected source.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div data-highlight="warn">
            <p>When adjusting the Return Behavior, no Hardware Source should be moved or held during this time, otherwise clipping problems in the modulation may occur.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>
</body>

        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-05-3-hw-mapping.html" data-number="4.5.3">Mapping a Hardware Source to Macro Controls</a>

<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.5.3">Mapping a Hardware Source to Macro Controls</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Focus on Assignment Aspects</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Hardware Source assignment aspects (Soft Buttons)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-hw-focus-assign-asp.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>By default, the <span data-keyword="Hardware Source"></span> position is in focus. <span data-keyword="Soft Button">1</span> to <span data-keyword>4</span> provide focus navigation. Press a button twice to return to the default focus. One Hardware Source can be selected, and its effect on one <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span> can be edited.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Focus on Assignment Aspects</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Modulation Matrix">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-hw-src-amt.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The top-center parameter group <q>Hardware Sources and Amounts</q> provides access to all <span data-keyword="Hardware">Sources</span> and their amounts on <span data-keyword="Macro">Controls</span>, represented as a modulation matrix. Items of interest can be selected and adjusted like parameters.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">HW Source Selector</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Hardware Source selector (Soft Button 1)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-hw-sel.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Press <span data-keyword="Soft Button">1</span> in order to select a particular <span data-keyword="Hardware">Source</span>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">HW Source Amount</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Hardware Source Amount (Soft Button 3)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-hw-hw-amt.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Pressing <span data-keyword="Soft Button">3</span> will redirect to the <span data-keyword="Hardware">Amount</span> screen, showing the amount of the currently selected <span data-keyword="Hardware">Source</span> on the currently associated <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span>. The amount can be edited like adjusting a parameter. Pressing <span data-keyword="Soft Button">1</span> will redirect to the Hardware Source, <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span> will redirect to the Macro Control.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">MC Target Selection Stack</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="MC Target selection stack">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-hw-sel-stack.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Pressing <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span> will cycle through the rightmost stack of <span data-keyword="Macro">Controls</span> in order to change the current association.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>

<body class="main-grid" data-path="root/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-06-presets/04-06-1-loading">
<!-- menu: location -->
<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html">User Manual</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-00-user-interfaces.html" data-number="4">User Interfaces</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-06-0-presets.html" data-number="4.6">Presets</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-06-1-preset-loading.html" data-number="4.6.1">Loading a Preset</a>
    </label>
</div>
<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.6.1">Loading a Preset</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Preset Navigation</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset screen">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/mp-pre-sb2-sb3-dec-inc-enc.png"></picture>
                </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Press the <span data-keyword="Preset">Button</span> in order to focus on the <span data-keyword="Preset">Screen</span>. The <span data-keyword="Encoder"></span> as well as the <span data-keyword="Inc"></span> and <span data-keyword="Dec"></span> buttons will navigate through the current Bank. <span data-keyword="Soft Button">2</span> and <span data-keyword="Soft Button">3</span> navigate banks. The selection is indicated by a rectangle.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Base Unit">Preset Navigation</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Base Unit Control Panel (Preset Mode)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/preset/soled-bup-pre-nav.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The <span data-keyword="Base Unit">Control Panel</span> can be set in <span data-keyword="Preset">Mode</span> by the <span data-keyword="Mode">Button</span> <i>(usually by pressing the Mode Button for a second, see <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-15-base-unit-functionality.html" data-number="4.15" class="label">Base Unit Functionality</a>)</i>. Using <span data-keyword="+"></span>/<span data-keyword="-">Buttons</span> will navigate through the current bank. Both <span data-keyword="Ribbons"></span> will remain in <span data-keyword="Play">Mode</span>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Preset Navigation</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Banks in the Graphical UI">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/preset/webui-pre-banks.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>In the main area, every bank is available and can be dragged on any position. If expanded, presets can be selected by clicking.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Current Bank in the Preset Tab">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/preset/webui-pre-bank-nav-tab.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>In the <span data-keyword="Preset">Tab</span>, the currently selected bank can be navigated by clicking on the corresponding navigation icons.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Arrow keys">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/info-gfk/gfk-tast-pfeile.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The <span data-keyword="Arrow">Keys</span> can be used to navigate presets (up, down) and banks (left, right). If the external device features a mouse, the <span data-keyword="Mouse">Wheel</span> can also be used for navigating the currently selected bank in the <span data-keyword="Preset">Tab</span> when hovering it.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Loading a Preset</h3>
        <p>When loading a preset, every parameter will start a transition to the new value (specified by the selected preset). The transition is defined by the <span data-keyword="Transition">Time</span> in the system settings.</p>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Enter Button">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/mp-enter-preset.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>On the <span data-keyword="Panel">Unit</span> press the <span data-keyword="Enter">Button</span> in order to load the selected preset.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Base Unit">Loading a Preset</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Base Unit Control Panel (Preset Mode)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/preset/soled-bup-pre-load.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>On the <span data-keyword="Base">Unit</span> press the <span data-keyword="Funct">Button</span> in order to load the selected preset.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Loading a Preset</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset Load icon (Preset Tab)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/preset/webui-pre-load-icon.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>On the <span data-keyword="Graphical">User Interface</span> the <span data-keyword="Preset">Tab</span> provides a <span data-keyword="Load">Icon</span> in order to load the currently selected preset. Or click on a bank element twice.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>The described load process will load a particular preset <i>fully</i>, meaning that individual <span data-keyword="Parts"></span> of a <span data-keyword="Split"></span> or <span data-keyword="Layer"></span> sound will be overwritten. Note that it is also possible to load a preset (or part of a preset) into a part, meaning that the particular preset will only be partially loaded <i>(see chapter <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-08-0-part-manipulation.html" data-number="4.8">Part Manuipulation</a> for more details)</i>.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Direct Load</h3>
        <p>The process of loading Presets can be shortened by using the Direct Load option, which allows for loading Presets directly upon selection.</p>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Direct Load (Soft Button 4)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/mp-sb4-preset.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>On the <span data-keyword="Panel">Unit</span> press <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span> in order to toggle the Direct Load option.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Base Unit">Direct Load</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Direct Load (Funct Button)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/preset/soled-bup-pre-dir-load.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>On the <span data-keyword="Base">Unit</span> hold the <span data-keyword="Funct">Button</span> for a second to toggle the Direct Load option.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Direct Load</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Direct Load icon (Preset Tab)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/preset/webui-pre-dir-load-icon.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>On the <span data-keyword="Graphical">User Interface</span> press the Direct Load icon in the <span data-keyword="Preset">Tab</span> in order to toggle the Direct Load option.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Bank Navigation</h3>
        <p>Next to the actual presets, banks contain additional metadata <i>(some of which can be edited, see chapter <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-09-contextual-info.html" data-number="4.9">Contextual Info</a>)</i>. For example, they keep track of their last selected preset, which may be loaded when navigating banks <i>(depending on the Direct Load option)</i>.</p>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Bank Navigation (Soft Button 1)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/mp-sb1-preset.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>On the <span data-keyword="Panel">Unit</span> press <span data-keyword="Soft Button">1</span> in order to focus on banks and navigate them instead. <span data-keyword="Soft Button">2</span> and <span data-keyword="Soft Button">3</span> will navigate presets now.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Base Unit">Bank Navigation</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Base Unit Control Panel (Bank Mode)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/preset/soled-bup-bank-nav.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>On the <span data-keyword="Base">Unit</span> switch to <span data-keyword="Bank">Mode</span> by the <span data-keyword="Mode">Button</span>. Using the <span data-keyword="+"></span>/<span data-keyword="-">Buttons</span> will now navigate banks.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Bank Navigation</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Bank Navigation (Preset Tab)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/preset/webui-pre-bank-nav-tab.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>In the <span data-keyword="Preset">Tab</span>, banks can be navigated by the corresponding navigation icons (the left and right arrow keys can be used as well, as described.).</p>
                <p>In the main area, clicking/touching on the header of a floating bank will select the bank, clicking/touching on a preset will select only the preset. After loading the selected preset, the bank selection will update as well, indicating the bank containing the loaded preset.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>The Direct Load option will be indicated on each interface. The <span data-keyword="Panel Unit">Display</span> and the <span data-keyword="Graphical">User Interface</span> also show the preset count of a selected bank (in brackets) and the current bank-preset-number.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>

<!-- menu: location -->
<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html">User Manual</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-00-user-interfaces.html" data-number="4">User Interfaces</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-06-0-presets.html" data-number="4.6">Presets</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-06-2-preset-storing.html" data-number="4.6.2">Storing a Preset</a>
    </label>
</div>
<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.6.2">Storing a Preset</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Store Select</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Store Screen">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/preset/boled-pre-store-sel.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Press the <span data-keyword="Store">Button</span> in order to focus on the <span data-keyword="Store">Screen</span> and start the <span data-keyword="Store Select">Mode</span>. The store position and bank can be adjusted by preset and bank navigation (as described in chapter <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-06-1-preset-loading.html" data-number="4.6.1">Loading a Preset</a>). The process can be canceled by pressing the Store Button again, pressing the <span data-keyword="Enter">Button</span> on the other hand will complete the Store process, storing the preset at the desired location according to the Store Method (see below).</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Store Select</h3>
        <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Store Icon (Preset Tab)">
            <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/preset/webui-pre-preset-overwrite.png"></picture>
        </figure>
        <p>The <span data-keyword="Preset">Tab</span> provides a <span data-keyword="Store">Icon</span>. Clicking/touching on it will store the preset in the currently selected bank at the current position, according to the <span data-keyword="Store">Method</span> <i>(see below)</i>. The additional <span data-keyword="Select">Button</span> will start the <span data-keyword="Store Select">Mode</span> and a bank and position can be chosen (without loading any preset), then the preset can be stored at the desired location (disabling the Store Select Mode), according to the Store Method (see below). Another way of storing a preset in a particular bank or position is simply dragging and dropping the Store Icon to the desired location (the Store Select Mode and Store Method can be ignored in this case).</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Store Method</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Store Method (Soft Button 4)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/preset/boled-pre-store-method.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p><span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span> provides three available <span data-keyword="Store">Methods</span> in the rightmost stack and cycles it. Pressing the <span data-keyword="Enter">Button</span> applies the process, pressing the <span data-keyword="Store">Button</span> again dismisses it. The store position will be finally influenced by the chosen Store Method, which can be one of the following three:</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div data-columns="1">
            <table>
                <tr>
                    <th>Append</th>
                    <td>The preset will be stored at the end of the currently selected bank.</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <th>Overwrite</th>
                    <td>The preset will be stored at the current position in the currently selected bank, overwriting the existing preset.</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <th>Insert</th>
                    <td>The preset will be stored behind the current position in the currently selected bank.</td>
                </tr>
            </table>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Store Method</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Store Method (menu)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/preset/webui-pre-store-method.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The <span data-keyword="Store">Method</span> can be selected in the <span data-keyword="Preset">Tab</span>, above the <span data-keyword="Store">Icon</span>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Preset Naming</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Rename Screen">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/preset/boled-pre-name.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>If the preset is considered <q>new</q>, the <span data-keyword="Rename">Screen</span> will appear, requesting a name for the preset <i>(see chapter <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-12-rename-mechanism.html" data-number="4.12">The Rename Mechanism</a> for more details)</i>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>
