<!-- menu: location -->
<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html">User Manual</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-00-user-interfaces.html" data-number="4">User Interfaces</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-06-0-presets.html" data-number="4.6">Presets</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-06-3-preset-bank-editing.html" data-number="4.6.3">Editing Presets and Banks</a>
    </label>
</div>
<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.6.3">Editing Presets and Banks</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <p>Common <b>Preset editing</b> actions are listed in the table below:</p>
        <div data-columns="">
            <table>
                <tr>
                    <th>Rename</th>
                    <td>The selected preset can be renamed (see chapter <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-12-rename-mechanism.html" data-number="4.12">The Rename Mechanism</a> for details).</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <th>Cut</th>
                    <td>The selected preset will be moved into the clipboard (being deleted at the current position).</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <th>Copy</th>
                    <td>The selected preset(s) will be copied into the clipboard, ready to be pasted at any time.</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <th>Paste</th>
                    <td>Once a preset was copied or cut into the clipboard, this option will become available. The copied preset(s) will be inserted behind the currently selected preset.</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <th>Delete</th>
                    <td>The selected preset(s) will be deleted from the bank.</td>
                </tr>
            </table>
        </div>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>When deleting all presets of a bank at once from the Graphical User Interface, a Dialog window will appear, asking if the bank should be deleted as well.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Preset Edit Mode</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset Edit screen - options (Soft Button 4)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/preset/boled-pre-edit-mode.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When the <span data-keyword="Preset">Screen</span> is in focus, pressing the <span data-keyword="Edit">Button</span> invokes a menu, represented in the rightmost stack. Cycle the stack by pressing <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span> in order to select a menu entry and press the <span data-keyword="Enter">Button</span> in order to focus on an aspect. Press the Edit Button again to return to the Preset Screen.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Preset Edit Mode</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset Edit menus">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/preset/webui-pre-ctx-menus.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>In the <span data-keyword="Preset">Tab</span>, a Preset menu button is provided. Clicking on this button or right-clicking (or long touch gesture) on a preset element in a (floating) bank invokes the context menu, providing access to all aspects.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <p>Common <b>Bank editing</b> actions are listed in the table below:</p>
        <div data-columns="1">
            <table>
                <tr>
                    <th>New</th>
                    <td>A new bank will be created.</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <th>Rename</th>
                    <td>The selected bank can be renamed (see chapter <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-12-rename-mechanism.html" data-number="4.12">The Rename Mechanism</a> for details).</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <th>Copy</th>
                    <td>The selected bank will be copied into a temporary buffer, ready to be pasted.</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <th>Paste</th>
                    <td>
                        <div class="section">
                            <p>Once a bank was copied into the clipboard, this option will become available.</p>
                            <div data-highlight="warn">
                                <p>The copied bank will be appended as a new bank. This mechanism is not fully developed yet.</p>
                                <!-- <p>For more information, refer to the separate <a href="./documents/known-issues/index.html" class="label">Known Issues</a> document.</p> -->
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <th>Delete</th>
                    <td>The selected bank will be deleted.</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <th>Move left/right</th>
                    <td>The bank number (position in the bank list, visible in the <span data-keyword="Preset">Screen</span> and <span data-keyword="Preset">Tab</span>) can be altered by moving it left (decreasing the position) or right (increasing the position).</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <th>Import/Export</th>
                    <td>Single Banks can be transferred from and to external devices <i>(see chapter <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-06-4-bank-importing-exporting.html" data-number="4.6.4">Importing/Exporting Banks</a> for more details)</i>.</td>
                </tr>
            </table>
        </div>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>The <span data-keyword="Graphical">User Interface</span> provides another way of moving a bank via the <span data-keyword="Bank Info">Window</span>, where the bank number (position in the bank list) can be adjusted directly <i>(see chapter <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-09-contextual-info.html" data-number="4.9">Contextual Info</a> for more details)</i>.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Bank Edit Mode</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Bank Edit screen - options (Soft Button 4)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/preset/boled-pre-edit-mode-bnk.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When the <span data-keyword="Bank">Screen</span> is in focus, pressing the <span data-keyword="Edit">Button</span> invokes a menu, represented in the rightmost stack. Cycle the stack by pressing <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span> in order to select a menu entry and press the <span data-keyword="Enter">Button</span> in order to focus on an aspect. Press the <span data-keyword="Edit">Button</span> again to return to the Bank screen.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Bank Edit Mode</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Bank Edit menus">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/preset/webui-pre-ctx-bank-menus.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The <span data-keyword="Graphical">User Interface</span> provides two menus for editing banks. There is a global menu (invoked by a right-click / long touch gesture on the background) and a local menu for banks (provided by a bank menu icon in the <span data-keyword="Preset">Tab</span> or by a right-click / long touch gesture on any bank header).</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>

<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.6.4">Importing/Exporting Banks</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <p>The C15 provides two ways of transferring (importing, exporting) single banks in order to manage big preset collections. When importing a bank, the bank will not be selected and no preset will be loaded.</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Import and Export on USB stick</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Bank Edit screen - import/export options (Soft Button 4)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/preset/boled-pre-imp-exp.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When a USB stick is connected, the selected bank can be exported to it by using the <span data-keyword="Export">option</span>. Any bank present on the USB stick can be selected and imported by using the <span data-keyword="Import">option</span>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Import and Export on external Device</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Bank Edit menu - import/export options (Preset Tab)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/preset/webui-pre-ctx-im-ex-bank.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The bank menu provides an option to save the current bank as a file, which will be downloaded on the external device. The menu also includes an option to import a particular bank from a file present on the external device, which can be selected and uploaded. Other Bank context menus <i>(as explained in chapter <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-16-0-graphical-ui-functionality.html" data-number="4.16">Graphical UI Functionality</a>)</i> will also offer import and export options.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>The process of transferring multiple banks can be further simplified by the C15 backup capabilities. See chapter <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-14-backups.html" data-number="4.14">Backups</a> for more details.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>
</body>
</html>

<!-- menu: location -->
<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html">User Manual</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-00-user-interfaces.html" data-number="4">User Interfaces</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-06-0-presets.html" data-number="4.6">Presets</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-06-5-preset-locking.html" data-number="4.6.5">Locking</a>
    </label>
</div>
<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.6.5">Locking</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <p>In some situations, it may be useful to load only specific parts of a preset while leaving other parts as they are. This can be achieved by using the <span data-keyword="Lock">Mechanism</span>, which can lock particular parameter groups and prevent the contained parameters from being overwritten by a preset recall or sound manipulations. Parameters of locked groups can still be edited, though.</p>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>Currently, only whole groups can be locked, but a parameter-specific Lock Mechanism is intended for the future.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Locking a Parameter Group</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Parameter Lock screen - options (Soft Button 4)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-param-lock-menu.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>In the <span data-keyword="Parameter">Screen</span> showing the currently selected parameter, the <span data-keyword="Edit">Button</span> provides the lock menu. Individual lock options can be selected by pressing <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span> and applied by pressing the <span data-keyword="Enter">Button</span>.</p>
            </div>
            <div>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Parameter screen - Lock symbol">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-param-lock-symbol.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset screen - Lock symbol">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/preset/boled-pre-lock-symbol.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound screen - Lock symbol">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-lock-symbol.png"></picture>
                </figure>
            </div>      
            <div>
                <p>Depending on the lock status of the associated group, the lock options provide locking the specific group/all groups, or unlocking the specific group/all groups. When one or more groups are locked, the lock symbol is also shown in the <span data-keyword="Preset">Screen</span> and <span data-keyword="Sound">Screen</span>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-details="Graphical UI">Locking a Parameter Group</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Parameter Group - menu">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-ctx-group.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>A right click or long touch gesture on a particular group header invokes the lock menu. Depending on the lock status of the associated group, the lock options provide locking the specific group/all groups, or unlocking the specific group/all groups.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Parameter Group , Preset Tab - Lock symbol">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-group-lock.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When one or more groups are locked, the lock symbol is also shown in the <span data-keyword="Preset">Tab</span> and <span data-keyword="Sound">Tab</span>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Modulation Matrix - Lock symbol">
            <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-hw-amt-src-lock.png"></picture>
        </figure>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>Note that <span data-keyword="Hardware">Sources</span> and <span data-keyword="Hardware">Amounts</span> are two separate lockable groups. In the <span data-keyword="Graphical User Interface"></span>, the header of the <q>Hardware Sources and Amounts</q> group shows two separate lock symbols.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3><i>Locking - a practical example</i></h3>
        <p>Let’s consider a situation where the user wants to use certain groups of preset <span class="round">A</span> as a template for other presets (<span class="round">B</span>, <span class="round">C</span>, ...), which shall have those group settings as well.</p>
        <p>Useful scenarios may be the <span data-keyword="Hardware">Sources</span> and their Amounts on <span data-keyword="Macro">Controls</span>, or the whole effect chain. In a few steps, the particular groups of preset <span class="round">A</span> can be copied to the other presets:</p>
        <ol>
            <li>Load preset <span class="round">A</span> (the template preset).</li>
            <li>Activate lock on the desired groups (that shall be transferred to the other presets).</li>
            <li>Load preset <span class="round">B</span> (the locked groups still remain as defined by preset A).</li>
            <li>Save preset <span class="round">B</span> (making the template transfer persistent).</li>
            <li>Load and then save preset <span class="round">C</span> (repeating the process, the locked groups still remain as defined by preset <span class="round">A</span>), et cetera.</li>
        </ol>
    </section>
</main>
</div>
</body>
</html>

<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.7">Sound Manipulation</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <p>The current parameter setting can further be manipulated, affecting all the parameters of a a sound (or part) at once.</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Focus on Sound Screen</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound Button">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/mp-sound.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Pressing the <span data-keyword="Sound">Button</span> will invoke the <span data-keyword="Sound">Screen</span>, providing options to further manipulate the current sound.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Focus on Sound Tab</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound Tab">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-sound-tab.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The <span data-keyword="Sound">Tab</span> provides options to further manipulate the current sound. It can be focussed by selecting the corresponding tab icon (showing a keyboard).</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>

<!-- menu: location -->

        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html">User Manual</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-00-user-interfaces.html" data-number="4">User Interfaces</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-07-0-sound-manipulation.html" data-number="4.7">Sound Manipulation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-07-1-sound-main-parameters.html" data-number="4.7.1">Main Parameters of a Sound</a>
    </label>
</div>
<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.7.1">Main Parameters of a Sound</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <p>A few parameter groups are not directly available via <span data-keyword="Parameter Selection">Buttons</span> on the <span data-keyword="Panel">Unit</span>, on the <span data-keyword="Graphical">User Interface</span> they are available like ordinary parameter groups. In order to access them via the Panel Unit, press the <span data-keyword="Sound">Button</span>.</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Master: Volume, Tune and Scale</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound Screen - Master (Soft Button 4)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-sb4-master.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>On the <span data-keyword="Sound">Screen</span>, <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span> (<code>Master..</code>) opens the <span data-keyword="Master">Screen</span>, where the familiar Master (Volume and Tune) and Scale parameter groups can be found and navigated by <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span>.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Master Screen">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-master.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The Volume and Tune parameters are now modulateable, so the Master Volume could still be instantly accessable when using a <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary"><span class="sw-version">20-28</span> Voices: Mono and Unison</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound Screen - Voices (Soft Button 3)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-sb3-voices.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>On the <span data-keyword="Sound">Screen</span>, <span data-keyword="Soft Button">3</span> (<code>Voices..</code>) opens the <span data-keyword="Voices">Screen</span>, which shows an overview of the Unison and Mono parameters.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Voices Screen - Mono (Soft Button 2)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-voices-sb2.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>Pressing <span data-keyword="Soft Button">2</span> (<code>Mono..</code>) opens the <span data-keyword="Mono">Screen</span>, making individual Mono parameters available via <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span>.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Mono Screen - parameter stack (Soft Button 4)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-mono.png"></picture>
            </figure>
        </div>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Voices Screen - Unison (Soft Button 4)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-voices-sb4.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Pressing <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span> (<code>Unison..</code>) opens the <span data-keyword="Unison">Screen</span>, making individual Unison parameters available via <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span>.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Unison Screen - parameter stack (Soft Button 4)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-unison.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The maximum number of Unison Voices is now 24 for <span data-keyword="Single"></span> sounds and 12 for a <span data-keyword="Split"></span>/<span data-keyword="Layer"></span> sound. In Layer sounds the Unison settings are applied to both <span data-keyword="Parts"></span>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>Note that changes to the Mono Enable and/or Unison Voices parameters will reset held keys.</p>
        </div>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset Screen - Mono/Unison indicators">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/preset/boled-pre-mono-unison.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Mono Presets are marked with a <code><b>m</b></code> symbol. Unison Presets have a <code><b>u</b></code> symbol. Presets that combine both voice modes are marked <code><b>mu</b></code>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <p>More information about these parameters can be found in <a href="./documents/man-user/05-synth-engine/05-02-13-main-parameters.html" data-number="5.2.13">Main Parameter Groups and Post Processing</a>.</p>
    </section>
</main>
</div>
</body>

<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.7.2">Manipulating Sounds</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Init Sound</h3>
        <p>When initializing, every parameter of the sound (or part) will start a transition to its default value, as defined by the <span data-keyword="Edit">Smoothing Time</span> in the system settings.</p>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <div>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound Screen - Init (Soft Button 1)">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-init.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound Screen - Init (Soft Button 1)">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-init-snd-menu.png"></picture>
                </figure>
            </div>
            <div>
                <p>In <span data-keyword="Single"></span> sounds, press <span data-keyword="Soft Button">1</span> to select and then the <span data-keyword="Enter">Button</span> to recall the Init sound. In <span data-keyword="Split"></span> or <span data-keyword="Layer"></span> sounds, press the <span data-keyword="Edit">Button</span>, navigate to the Init Sound option using the <span data-keyword="Encoder"></span> or <span data-keyword="Inc"></span>/<span data-keyword="Dec"></span> and press the <span data-keyword="Enter">Button</span>. <i>(There is also an Init Part option in order to only initialize the selected Part.)</i></p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Init Sound</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <div>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound menu - init (Sound Tab)">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-sound-tab-ctx-more.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound menu - init (Sound Tab)">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-sound-tab-ctx-more-dual.png"></picture>
                </figure>
            </div>
            <div>
                <p>The <span data-keyword="Sound">Tab</span> contains a menu icon (<q>...</q>) which provides an Init option for <span data-keyword="Single"></span> sounds. The menu will instead contain the Init Sound and Init Part options, when the current sound type is <span data-keyword="Split"></span> or <span data-keyword="Layer"></span>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Store/Reset Init Sound</h3>
        <p>The Init Sound represents every parameter with it's default value. The default values were carefully chosen to form a meaningful initial state (in which no sound will play, as all channels of the Output Mixer are disabled). Nevertheless, custom defaults are also possible.</p>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Store/Reset Init Sound (Setup Screen)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-store-init-snd-menu.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>In order to store the current sound as the Init Sound, press the <span data-keyword="Setup">Button</span> and navigate to <code>Device Settings > Store Init Sound</code>, then press the <span data-keyword="Enter">Button</span> to confirm. The default Sound Type and the parameter values will be overwritten. In order to restore the factory defaults, chosse <code>Reset Init Sound</code> instead.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Store/Reset Init Sound</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Store/Reset Init Sound (Setup window)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-sound-store-reset-init.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Click on the <span data-keyword="View">Menu</span> in the top-right corner and choose Setup in order to open the <span data-keyword="Setup">Window</span>. In the first tab (Device Settings), the Store and Reset options can be found on the bottom.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>If you encounter problems navigating the <span data-keyword="Setup">Menu</span> intuitively, please refer to chapters <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-13-setup-navigation.html" data-number="4.13">Setup Navigation</a> and <a href="./documents/man-user/08-setup/08-setup.html" data-number="8">Setup (C15 System Settings)</a>.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Randomize</h3>
        <p>When randomizing, every parameter of the sound (or selected part) will start a transition to a randomized value, as defined by the <span data-keyword="Edit">Smoothing Time</span> in the system settings. The randomization amount is adjustable.</p>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound Edit screen - randomize">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-rand-snd-menu.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Press <span data-keyword="Edit"></span> and use the <span data-keyword="Encoder"></span> or<span data-keyword="Inc"></span>/<span data-keyword="Dec"></span> to navigate to <code>Randomize</code> (when in a <span data-keyword="Single"></span> sound) or <code>Randomize Part</code> (when in a <span data-keyword="Split"></span> or <span data-keyword="Layer"></span> sound), then press <span data-keyword="Enter"></span>. Now, the amount of randomization can be adjusted. To escape randomization, press <span data-keyword="Soft Buttons">1</span> or <span data-keyword>2</span>. To apply randomization, press Enter.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Randomize</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <div>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound menu - init (Sound Tab)">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-sound-tab-ctx-more.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound menu - init (Sound Tab)">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-sound-tab-ctx-more-dual.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound menu - init (Sound Tab)">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-sound-rand-dia.png"></picture>
                </figure>
            </div>
            <div>
                <p>In the <span data-keyword="Sound">Tab</span>, press the menu icon (<q>...</q>) and choose <code>Randomize</code> (when in a <span data-keyword="Single"></span> sound) or <code>Randomize Part</code> (when in a <span data-keyword="Split"></span> or <span data-keyword="Layer"></span> sound). A dialog will appear, providing the adjustable randomization amount and an <q>Apply</q> button to complete the process.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Sound Manipulation and Locking</h3>
        <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Parameter screen - Lock symbol">
            <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-param-lock-symbol.png"></picture>
        </figure>
        <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound Tab - Lock symbol">
            <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-sound-tab-lock.png"></picture>
        </figure>
        <p>As described in chapter <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-06-5-preset-locking.html" data-number="4.6.5">Locking</a>, parameters of locked groups are not affected by sound manipulations. For example, randomizing all parameters may not be a good idea when considering the Master, Unison and Scale groups, as the random change can have too much of an impact, leading to unwanted, bad sounding or even harmful results (should the Master Volume increase considerably). So we recommend to lock these three groups before using the randomize function.</p>
    </section>
</main>
</div>

<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html">User Manual</a>

        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-00-user-interfaces.html" data-number="4">User Interfaces</a>

        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-07-3-sound-conversion.html" data-number="4.7.3">Converting Sound Types</a>
    </label>

<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.7.3">Converting Sound Types</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <p>Since version <span class="sw-version">20-28</span>, <span data-keyword="Single"></span>, <span data-keyword="Split"></span> and <span data-keyword="Layer"></span> sounds can be converted inbetween. In general, most parameters will be available twice in <span data-keyword="Split"></span>/<span data-keyword="Layer"></span> sounds, although the details are a little more subtle. <i>(In order to explore the part structure in more detail, refer to the next chapter <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-08-0-part-manipulation.html" data-number="4.8">Part Manipulation</a>)</i>. In this section, the individual conversion methods are explained.</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Creating a Split or Layer Sound</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <div>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound Edit screen - convert">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-single-edit.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound screen - Split sound">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-split-preset.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound convert menu (Sound Tab)">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-sound-tab-convert.png"></picture>
                </figure>
            </div>
            <div>
                <p>First, load a <span data-keyword="Single"></span> preset. On the <span data-keyword="Sound">Screen</span> press <span data-keyword="Edit"></span> to open the <span data-keyword="Sound Edit">Screen</span>. Select <code>Convert to Split</code> or <code>Convert to Layer</code> by navigating with <span data-keyword="Dec"></span>/<span data-keyword="Inc"></span> or the <span data-keyword="Encoder"></span>, then press <span data-keyword="Enter"></span>. On the Sound Screen you now see two identical <span data-keyword="Parts"></span>. In the <span data-keyword="Graphical">User Interface</span>, the <span data-keyword="Sound">Tab</span> provides a menu on the left, allowing for a conversion between different sound types.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Storing a Split or Layer Sound as a Preset</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset screen - Sound type symbols">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/preset/boled-pre-split-layer-symbol.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>A <span data-keyword="Split"></span> or <span data-keyword="Layer"></span> sound can be stored in the same way as a <span data-keyword="Single"></span> sound. The C15 banks can hold presets of all three types. Split presets are marked with a &#xE0F2; symbol. Layer presets have a &#xE0F5; symbol.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Converting a Part of a Split or Layer Sound to a Single Sound</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound Edit screen - convert (part) to single">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-part-to-single.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>While in a <span data-keyword="Paremter"></span>, <span data-keyword="Part"></span> or <span data-keyword="Sound"></span> <span data-keyword>Screen</span>, select the part to be converted by <span data-keyword="Soft Button">1</span> (<code>I/II</code>). Then press <span data-keyword="Edit"></span> and navigate to the <code>Convert to Single</code> entry by using <span data-keyword="Dec"></span>/<span data-keyword="Inc"></span> or the <span data-keyword="Encoder"></span>, then press <span data-keyword="Enter"></span>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Converting a Split (Layer) Sound to a Layer (Split) Sound</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound Edit screen - convert to Split/Layer sound">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-conv-split-layer.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>While in a <span data-keyword="Paremter"></span>, <span data-keyword="Part"></span> or <span data-keyword="Sound"></span> <span data-keyword>Screen</span>, press <span data-keyword="Edit"></span> and navigate to the <code>Convert to Layer</code> (<code>Convert to Split</code>) entry by using <span data-keyword="Dec"></span>/<span data-keyword="Inc"></span> or the <span data-keyword="Encoder"></span>, then press <span data-keyword="Enter"></span>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>
</body>

<!-- menu: location -->
<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html">User Manual</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-00-user-interfaces.html" data-number="4">User Interfaces</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-08-0-part-manipulation.html" data-number="4.8">Part Manipulation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-08-1-part-main.html" data-number="4.8.1">Main Parameters of a Part</a>
    </label>
</div>
<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.8.1">Main Parameters of a Part</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Part Volume and Tune</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Part screen">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-part-vol-tune.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>In <span data-keyword="Split"></span>/<span data-keyword="Layer"></span> sounds, the Volume and Tune of a Part can be adjusted by its Part Volume and Part Tune parameters.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <p>The stereo signals of both <span data-keyword="Parts"></span> are mixed before the Master Volume control. The Master Tune is added to the two Part Tunes.</p>
        <p>When a <span data-keyword="Single"></span> Sound is converted to <span data-keyword="Split"></span>/<span data-keyword="Layer"></span>, its former Master Volume and Master Tune will be copied to its Part Volume and Part Tune while Master Volume and Master Tune are set to zero. When a <span data-keyword="Single"></span> Sound is loaded into a <span data-keyword="Split"></span> or <span data-keyword="Layer"></span> Sound, its former Master Volume and Master Tune will also be copied to its Part Volume and Part Tune but Master Volume and Master Tune stay unchanged.</p>
        <p>When a <span data-keyword="Part"></span> of a <span data-keyword="Split"></span>/<span data-keyword="Layer"></span> sound is converted to <span data-keyword="Single"></span>, the Master Volume and Master Tune values are summed up with Part Volume and Part Tune to create the Master Volume and Master Tune of the Single Sound. Furthermore, the delegation of the Master Volume/Tune to the Part Volume/Tune parameters also includes potential assignments to <span data-keyword="Macro">Controls</span>.</p>
        <p>In Dual (<span data-keyword="Split"></span>/<span data-keyword="Layer"></span>) sounds, the Part Volume/Tune is designed to serve as the potential Master, should the Part get converted to <span data-keyword="Single"></span> again. In order for this to work properly, we recommend not to create <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span> assignments to Master Volume/Tune within Dual Presets. Or to be more precise: these assignments will be discarded, when converting a Dual Preset back to Single.</p>
    </section>
</main>
</div>
</body>
</html>

<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.8.2">Working with Parameters of Split or Layer Sounds</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Parameter Screen - Part selector (Soft Button 1)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-param-dual.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When editing a <span data-keyword="Split"></span>/<span data-keyword="Layer"></span> Sound in the <span data-keyword="Parameter">Screen</span>, <span data-keyword="Soft Button">1</span> is labeled <code>I/II</code> and can be used to access the parameters of both parts. A square with two part indicators show which part is in focus.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Part indicator/selector (Graphical UI)">
            <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-split-layer-p1.png"></picture>
        </figure>
        <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Part indicator/selector (Graphical UI)">
            <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-split-layer-p2.png"></picture>
        </figure>
        <p>On the <span data-keyword="Graphical">User Interface</span> there is a colored frame around the main area including an indicator for the selected part. A touch/click on the indicator opens the parameters of the other part.</p>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>By default, both <span data-keyword="Hardware"></span> and <span data-keyword="Graphical">User Interfaces</span> share the same part focus, meaning that part selection is reflected everywhere. However, the <span data-keyword="Hardware">User Interface</span> has its own part focus and can ignore part selections in the <span data-keyword="Graphical">User Interface</span>, if explicitly enabled in the system settings, see chapter <a href="./documents/man-user/08-setup/08-setup.html" data-number="8">Setup (C15 System Settings)</a>.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>

<!-- menu: location -->
<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html">User Manual</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-00-user-interfaces.html" data-number="4">User Interfaces</a>

<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.8.3">Split Sound Details</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Adjusting the Split Point</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound screen - Split sound">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-split-preset.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>On the Split <span data-keyword="Sound">Screen</span> the Split Point is shown in the center. It can be edited directly by the <span data-keyword="Encoder"></span> and <span data-keyword="Dec"></span>/<span data-keyword="Inc"></span>. If <span data-keyword="Part">I</span> is selected it shows the highest key of the lower key range. If <span data-keyword="Part">II</span> is selected it shows the lowest key of the upper key range. The Split Point is also available as a parameter in the <span data-keyword="Part">Screen</span>. Use <span data-keyword="Soft Button">2</span> (<code><b>Part..</b></code>) to open it.</p>
            </div>
            <div>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Parameter screen - Split Point">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-split-adjust-split-point.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Split mechanism">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-split-adjust-split-point-gfk.png"></picture>
                </figure>
            </div>

            <div>
                <p>On the <span data-keyword="Part">Screen</span>, navigate with <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span> to the third parameter. The Split Point parameter can be controlled by a <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span>. As Hardware Source, a ribbon will make a lot of sense. The part association of individual voices happens only when a key is pressed, according to the current value of the Split Point.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <p>By default, the Split Point is <i>linked</i> - meaning that both <span data-keyword="Parts"></span> don't overlap <i>(see <q>Overlapping Split Points</q> below in order to produce intersections).</i></p>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Adjusting the Split Point</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Part group (Graphical UI)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-snd-split-split-point.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>In the <span data-keyword="Graphical">User Interface</span>, the <span data-keyword="Sound">Tab</span> provides the Split Point between the two parts. Use drag gestures in order to change it. In addition, the <span data-keyword="Part"></span> group (left to the Master group) provides the Split Point as a regular parameter, which can be manipulated further in the <span data-keyword="Parameter">Tab</span> when selected.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Overlapping Split Points</h3>
        <p>In earlier versions, the C15 only provided one Split Point parameter in a <span data-keyword="Split"></span> sound, determining the inner edges of both fully separated <span data-keyword="Parts"></span>, so no overlap was possible.The described behavior is still available by default and referred to as <i>linked</i> Split Points. Now, <i>unlinked</i> Split Points are available as well, providing separate Split Points for each part (but still sharing one unique <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span> assignment).</p>
        <p>When <i>unlinked</i>, an overlapping range of shared keys can be defined, in which both <span data-keyword="Parts"></span> will sound. The two Split Point parameters are still sticked to one another, preventing a negative overlap with a key range with no part association. The linking behavior can be changed by the <span data-keyword="Edit">Button</span>:</p>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Parameter Edit screen - linked Split Point">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-unlink-split-point.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When in the <span data-keyword="Parameter">Screen</span>, pressing <span data-keyword="Edit"></span> will provide a menu with the option to <code><b>Unlink/Link</b></code>. Navigate with <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span> for the entry before pressing <span data-keyword="Enter"></span>.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Parameter Screen - unlinked Split Point">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-edit-unlinked-split-point.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When <i>unlinked</i>, the key positions of both <span data-keyword="Parts"></span> are shown. Overlap can be achieved by raising the Split Point of <span data-keyword="Part">I</span> or by lowering the Split Point of <span data-keyword="Part">II</span> - using <span data-keyword="Dec"></span>/<span data-keyword="Inc"></span> or the <span data-keyword="Encoder"></span>.</p>
            </div>
            <div>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound screen - linked Split Point">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-split.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound Edit screen - Link Splitpoints">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-link-split-point-option.png"></picture>
                </figure>
            </div>
            <div>
                <p>When in the <span data-keyword="Sound">Screen</span>, pressing <span data-keyword="Edit"></span> will provide a menu screen. Navigate with <span data-keyword="Dec"></span>/<span data-keyword="Inc"></span> or the <span data-keyword="Encoder"></span> to the <code><b>Link Splitpoints</b></code> option and press <span data-keyword="Enter"></span> to toggle between the two behaviors.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound screen - unlinked Split Points">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-split-split-point-unlinked.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When <i>unlinked</i>, the key positions of both <span data-keyword="Parts"></span> are shown.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>Enabling a <i>linked</i> Split Point will collapse any prior overlapping range. </p>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Overlapping Split Points</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Split Point - link icon (Parameter Tab)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-snd-split-unlinked.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>In the <span data-keyword="Parameter">Tab</span>, an icon on the right of the shown key position indicates the <code><b>linked</b></code>/<code><b>unlinked</b></code> Split Point behavior. Clicking on it will toggle inbetween.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound menu - link options (Sound Tab)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-snd-ctx-link-behav.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>In the <span data-keyword="Sound">Tab</span>, clicking on the <q>...</q> icon on the right invokes a menu in which the linking behavior can be set.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI only">Split Point Editor</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Split Point Editor icon (Sound Tab)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-snd-split-split-edit.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>In the <span data-keyword="Sound">Tab</span>, the rightmost icon redirects to the <span data-keyword="Split Point">Editor</span>, providing the two parameters and an interactive visual representation.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Split Point Editor">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-sound-split-edit.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Split Points can be set by clicking or dragging on the corresponding values or by dragging the indicators on the shown keybed. The linking behavior can be set as well.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Signal Flow Indicators in a Split Sound</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound screen - Split Sound FX signal flow indicator">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-split-crossfx-indicator.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>In <span data-keyword="Split"></span> sounds, the <q>ToFX</q> parameter is available in the Output Mixer, allowing the mixed signal to be sent to the Effects section of the other <span data-keyword="Part"></span>. When active, the flow across parts will be indicated in the <span data-keyword="Sound">Screen</span>/<span data-keyword>Tab</span> by labeled <q>FX</q> arrows.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound Tab - Split Sound FX signal flow indicator">
            <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-snd-split-crossfx-indicator.png"></picture>
        </figure>
    </section>
</main>
</div>

<!-- menu: location -->
<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html">User Manual</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-00-user-interfaces.html" data-number="4">User Interfaces</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-08-0-part-manipulation.html" data-number="4.8">Part Manipulation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-08-4-part-layer.html" data-number="4.8.4">Layer Sound Details</a>
    </label>
</div>
<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.8.4">Layer Sound Details</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Key Fades in Layer Sounds</h3>
        <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Key Fade mechanism (Layer Sound)">
            <picture class="content" data-src="images/info-gfk/gfk-keyfades.png"></picture>
        </figure>
        <p>Each <span data-keyword="Part"></span> of a <span data-keyword="Layer"></span> sound has two parameters to control the key range where this part is mixed at its full level and a key range where it is faded out to silence. Depending on the key position the voices are processed by an attenuator in the Level stage of the Output Mixer.</p>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <div>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Parameter screen - Fade From">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/mp-sound-layer-sb2.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Parameter screen - Fade From">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-part-fade-from.png"></picture>
                </figure>
            </div>
            <div>
                <p>To adjust key fade aspects press the <span data-keyword="Sound">Button</span> for the <span data-keyword="Sound">Screen</span>, then <span data-keyword="Soft Button">2</span> for the <span data-keyword="Part">Screen</span>. <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span> then brings the parameters into focus.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Key Fades in Layer Sounds</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Part Group - Fade From">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-snd-part-layer-fade.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>In the <span data-keyword="Graphical">User Interface</span>, the <span data-keyword="Part"></span> group (left to the Master group) provides the Fade From and Fade Range parameters, when a <span data-keyword="Layer"></span> sound is loaded.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <p>The full level range of <span data-keyword="Part">I</span> spans from the lowest key (C1) to the adjustable <q>Fade From</q> key. Here begins the fade-out. Its width is adjustable by the <q>Fade Range</q> parameter.</p>
        <p>The full level range of <span data-keyword="Part">II</span> spans from the highest key (C6) to the adjustable <q>Fade From</q> key. Here begins the fade-out. Its width is adjustable by the <q>Fade Range</q> parameter. Both parameters default to being without effect.</p>
        <p>Possible applications for these key fade ranges:</p>
        <ul>
            <li>keyboard splits with a smooth transition (crossfade) between the parts</li>
            <li>one of the parts being added only at the low or high end of the keyboard</li>
            <li>crossfades over a wide keyboard range to change the resulting timbre gradually</li>
        </ul>
        <div class="developer" data-highlight="comment">
            <h4>Current Limitations/Issues</h4>
            <p>When a Note is <q>stolen</q> <i>(all free voices are exhausted, e.g. by high <b>Unison</b> Voices, <b>Mono</b> enabled)</i>, key fades can produce audible artifacts (clicks) as the part volume changes immediately with the beginning Note - despite of the corresponding Voice already being audible (active).</p>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Muting a Part of a Layer Sound</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <div>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound screen - Part muting">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-layer-mute.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound screen - Part muting">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/mp-enc-dec-inc.png"></picture>
                </figure>
            </div>
            <div>
                <p>On the Layer <span data-keyword="Sound">Screen</span> you can use the <span data-keyword="Encoder"></span> and <span data-keyword="Dec"></span>/<span data-keyword="Inc"></span> to mute one of the <span data-keyword="Parts"></span>: turning the Encoder to the left or using Dec will mute <span data-keyword="Part">II</span>. Turning the Encoder to the right or using Inc will mute <span data-keyword="Part">I</span>. The first step back to the center will unmute the muted part.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Parameter screen - Part muting">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-layer-mute-pre-screen.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Typical screens (<span data-keyword="Parameter"></span>/<span data-keyword="Preset"></span>/<span data-keyword="Sound"></span>) will indicate the two present parts, highlighting the selected part. When a <span data-keyword="Layer"></span> sound's part has been muted, a cross indicates the muted part.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Mute screen (Shift Button)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/mp-shift-sb1-mute.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>On the Layer <span data-keyword="Part">Screen</span> the <span data-keyword="Shift">Button</span> will provide part muting via <span data-keyword="Soft Button">1</span>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Muting a Part of a Layer Sound</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Mute icons (Sound Tab)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-sound-tab-layer-mute.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The <span data-keyword="Graphical">User Interface</span> provides a <span data-keyword="Part">Inddicator</span> similar to the screens. It is located centered at the top. When a <span data-keyword="Layer"></span> sound part has been muted, a cross indicates the muted part. The <span data-keyword="Sound">Tab</span> provides a mute button for each part. Clicking on a muted part’s button will unmute the part, clicking on an unmuted part’s button will mute the part, potentially unmuting the other.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>When muting a <span data-keyword="Part"></span> of a <span data-keyword="Layer"></span> sound, only the final Part Volume stage will be affected, so any signal flow across parts will be maintained regardless.</p>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI only">Fade Editor</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Fade Editor icon (Sound Tab)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-snd-layer-edit-icon.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>In the <span data-keyword="Sound">Tab</span>, the rightmost icon redirects to the <span data-keyword="Fade">Editor</span>, providing all related aspects and an interactive visual representation.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Fade Editor">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-snd-layer-editor.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>For each part, Fade From and Fade Range can be adjusted by clicking or dragging on the corresponding values or by dragging the indicators shown on the keybed.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Indicators in a Layer Sound</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Layer Sound screen - FX indicator">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-layer-crossfx-indicator.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>In <span data-keyword="Layer"></span> Sounds, the <q>ToFX</q> parameter is available in the Output Mixer, allowing the mixed signal to be sent to the Effects section of the other <span data-keyword="Part"></span>.</p>
                <p>When active, the flow across parts will be indicated in the <span data-keyword="Sound">Screen</span>/<span data-keyword>Tab</span> by labeled <q>FX</q> arrows.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Layer Sound screen - FB indicator">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-layer-crossfb-indicator.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>In the Feedback Mixer, several parameters allow for feedback flow across <span data-keyword="Parts"></span>.</p>
                <p>When active, the flow across parts will be indicated in the Sound <span data-keyword="Sound">Screen</span>/<span data-keyword>Tab</span> by labeled <q>FB</q> arrows.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Layer Sound screen - Fade indicator">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-layer-fade-indicators.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When Key Fades are present, they also will be indicated in the <span data-keyword="Sound">Screen</span>/<span data-keyword>Tab</span> by a small fade graph next to the Part Volume.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Flow indicators (Sound Tab)">
            <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-sound-layer-cross-indicators.png"></picture>
        </figure>
    </section>
</main>
</div>
</body>

<!-- menu: location -->
<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html">User Manual</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-00-user-interfaces.html" data-number="4">User Interfaces</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-08-0-part-manipulation.html" data-number="4.8">Part Manipulation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-08-5-part-loading.html" data-number="4.8.5">Loading from/into Parts</a>
    </label>
</div>
<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.8.5">Loading from/into Parts</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <p>In the following, a step by step guide leads through every stage of the <q>Load to Part</q> process. Although this process can be shortened, we recommend following the guide until being familiar with the stages.</p>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>We also recommend to not change the <span data-keyword="Hardware">Sources</span> or <span data-keyword="Macro">Controls</span> during the <q>Load to Part</q> process, as they will affect both <span data-keyword="Parts"></span>. Changes on the modulation will be reflected when a part is loaded and can easily lead to unexpected assignments to modulateable parameters.</p>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Panel Unit"></h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <div>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound Edit screen - convert">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/snd-layer-pre-screen.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Sound Edit screen - convert">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-single-edit.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Split Sound screen">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-split-split-point.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Convert menu (Sound Tab)">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-sound-tab-convert.png"></picture>
                </figure>
            </div>
            <div>
                <p>At first, a <span data-keyword="Split"></span>/<span data-keyword="Layer"></span> preset has to be loaded, let's refer to it as the <q>Target</q> preset. It is worth mentioning that the <span data-keyword="Preset">Screen</span> will display Dual (Split/Layer) presets different to the already familiar <span data-keyword="Single"></span> presets, providing more functionality. Also, let's keep in mind we also have another Preset somewhere, from which to load data into a part, referred to as the <q>Source</q> Preset in the following.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset screen - Part options (Soft Buttons 1/4)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-pre-load-part-03.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When a Dual preset has been loaded, <span data-keyword="Soft Buttons">1</span>/<span data-keyword>4</span> will now each serve two purposes. In order to explain each individual step of the Load process, the <code><b>Direct Load</b></code> option should be disabled at first. Press and hold <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span> for around a second in order to do so.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset screen - To Part (Soft Button 4)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-pre-load-part-04.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Then press <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span> again (shortly this time) in order to enable the <code><b>To Part</b></code> mode, starting the Load process.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset screen - Part selector (Soft Button 1)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-pre-load-part-05.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Likewise, pressing <span data-keyword="Soft Button">1</span> shortly will select between the two parts of the Target preset, specifying exactly where to load new data.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <p>Press and hold <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span> for around a second in order to switch to the already familiar <span data-keyword="Bank">Screen</span>. If multiple banks are present, <span data-keyword="Dec"></span>/<span data-keyword="Inc"></span> as well as the <span data-keyword="Encoder"></span> will provide bank navigation.</p>
        <p>When in the <span data-keyword="Preset">Screen</span>, use the <span data-keyword="Encoder"></span> or <span data-keyword="Dec"></span>/<span data-keyword="Inc"></span> in order to select a Source preset within the currently selected bank. <span data-keyword="Soft Buttons">2</span>/<span data-keyword>3</span> can be used in order to select another bank. <i>(In the <span data-keyword="Bank">Screen</span>, preset/bank selection roles are reversed.)</i></p>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset screen - To Part, Single Preset">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-pre-load-part-07.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Of course, <span data-keyword="Single"></span> presets can be selected in order to serve as the Source preset, they are shown with a square.</p>
            </div>
            <div>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Bank screen - To Part">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-pre-load-part-06.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset screen - To Part, Layer Preset">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-pre-load-part-08.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            </div>
            <div>
                <p>Dual presets can be selected as well, as each individual <span data-keyword="Part"></span> is available for the selection. Dual presets are indicated by two rectangles instead of a square.</p>
            </div>
            <div>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset screen - load To Part (Enter Button)">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/sound/boled-snd-pre-load-part-09.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset screen - load To Part (Enter Button)">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/mp-enter.png"></picture>
                </figure>
            </div>
            <div>
                <p>When the right preset (or part) has been selected, <span data-keyword="Enter"></span> will complete the Load process, loading the selected Source preset into the specified <span data-keyword="Part"></span> of the Target preset.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>Note that the <q>Load to Part</q> process distinguishes and remembers different aspects of selection: </p>
            <dl class="info">
                <dt>selected Target</dt>
                <dd>referring to the currently loaded preset's selected part</dd>
                <dt>selected Source</dt>
                <dd>referring to the currently selected preset (if the preset is of Type <span data-keyword="Single"></span>) or the currently selected preset's part (if the preset is of Type <span data-keyword="Split"></span>/<span data-keyword="Layer"></span>)</dd>
            </dl>
            <p>This means, that any time the Load to Part process is invoked, all Source selection aspects are restored as they were the last time.</p>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI"></h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="To Part Button (Sound Tab)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-snd-preset-load-part.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>In the <span data-keyword="Graphical">User Interface</span>, the Load process is comparable. The <span data-keyword="Preset">Tab</span> provides a <code><b>To Part</b></code> button when a Dual preset has been loaded. Preset and bank navigation in the tab will behave similarly to the screens of the <span data-keyword="Hardware">User Interface</span>. </p>
                <p>Furthermore, individual presets of visible banks in the main area can be selected by clicking, shortening the whole process, especially when <code>Direct Load</code> is enabled.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset Drag & Drop to Part (Sound Tab)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/sound/webui-snd-preset-drag-part.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Presets can even directly be dragged and dropped onto a <span data-keyword="Part"></span> of the <span data-keyword="Sound">Tab</span>, further simplifying the whole process.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>When combining presets of different types, there are some limitations that should be considered. <i>(See <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-01-parameter-organization.html" data-number="4.1">Parameter Organization</a>.)</i></p>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>
</body>
