<!-- menu: location -->
<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html">User Manual</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-00-user-interfaces.html" data-number="4">User Interfaces</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-09-contextual-info.html" data-number="4.9">Contextual Info</a>
    </label>
</div>
<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.9">Contextual Info</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Parameter Info</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Parameter Info screen">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/txt/boled-txt-param-info.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Parameter Info screen">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/mp-enc-dec-inc.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            </div>
            <div>
                <p>When a parameter is selected, the <span data-keyword="Info">Button</span> invokes the <span data-keyword="Info">Screen</span>, showing the current parameter’s description. If the info text is too long to fit the screen, user <span data-keyword="Dec"></span>/<span data-keyword="Inc"></span> or the <span data-keyword="Encoder"></span> to scroll.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Parameter Info</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Parameter Info window">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-dia-param-info.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>In the <span data-keyword="Parameter">Tab</span>, an <span data-keyword="Info">Icon</span> is provided, toggling an Info window showing the description of the currently selected parameter. The window will update when selecting another parameter.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Macro Control Info</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Macro Control Info screen">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/txt/boled-txt-mc-info.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When a <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span> is selected, the <span data-keyword="Info">Button</span> invokes the <span data-keyword="Info">Screen</span>, showing the description of the currently selected Macro Control. When pressing <span data-keyword="Edit"></span>, the user-definable info text can be edited in the <span data-keyword="Rename">Screen</span>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Macro Control Info</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Macro Control Info window">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-dia-mc-info.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The <span data-keyword="Info">Icon</span> in the <span data-keyword="Parameter">Tab</span> works accordingly when selecting a <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span>, context menus for the main area elements are also provided. The provided Info window allows for edits on the user-definable info text.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Hardware Source/Amount Info</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Hardware Source/Amount Info screen">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/txt/boled-txt-hw-amt-info.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When the focus is on a <span data-keyword="Hardware">Source</span>/Amount, the <span data-keyword="Info">Button</span> provides the <span data-keyword="Info">Screen</span> according to the item in focus.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Hardware Source/Amount Info</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Hardware Source/Amount Info window">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-dia-hw-amt-info.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The Info window will display the description of a selected <span data-keyword="Hardware">Source</span>/Amount as described for ordinary parameters.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Preset Info</h3>
        <p>Presets contain a collection of metadata, some of which can be edited. The metadata collection includes: a reference to the parent bank name, the preset position within the parent bank, the preset name, a comment text, a color tag and information about the last saved change (date, device name, ui version).</p>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Panel Unit">Preset Info</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset Info screen">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/txt/boled-txt-preset-info.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When in the <span data-keyword="Preset">Screen</span>, press <span data-keyword="Info"></span> for the <span data-keyword="Info">Screen</span> of the currently selected preset. The screen can be scrolled by the <span data-keyword="Encoder"></span> or <span data-keyword="Dec"></span>/<span data-keyword="Inc"></span>. When pressing <span data-keyword="Edit"></span>, the comment text can be edited in the <span data-keyword="Rename">Screen</span>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Preset Info</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset Info window">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/preset/webui-pre-dia-preset-info.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The preset Info window can be made visible when clicking on the preset <span data-keyword="Info">Icon</span> in the <span data-keyword="Preset">Tab</span> or by a right click on a preset within a bank, selecting the show info option. The window can be left visible and will update when loading other presets. In addition, the global <span data-keyword="View"></span> menu also provides a visibility option for the preset Info window.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>In the <span data-keyword="Graphical">User Interface</span>, the preset Info window allows for editing the preset number (position in the bank), name, comment and color tag.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Bank Info</h3>
        <p>Banks contain a collection of metadata, some of which can be edited. The metadata collection includes: the bank number (position in the bank list), the bank name, a comment text, the bank size (number of contained presets), a state (indicating if unsaved changes occurred since the last export) as well as information about the last change (date), import (date, filename) and export (date, filename).</p>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Panel Unit">Bank Info</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Bank Info screen">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/txt/boled-txt-bank-info.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When in the <span data-keyword="Bank">Screen</span> (available when pressing <span data-keyword="Soft Button">1</span> while in the <span data-keyword="Preset">Screen</span>), press <span data-keyword="Info"></span> for the <span data-keyword="Info">Screen</span> of the currently selected bank. The screen can be scrolled by the <span data-keyword="Encoder"></span> or <span data-keyword="Dec"></span>/<span data-keyword="Inc"></span>. When pressing <span data-keyword="Edit"></span>, the comment text can be edited in the <span data-keyword="Rename">Screen</span>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Bank Info</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Bank Info window">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/preset/webui-pre-dia-bank-info.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The bank Info window can be made visible when clicking on the bank <span data-keyword="Info">Icon</span> in the <span data-keyword="Preset">Tab</span> or by selecting <code><b>show info</b></code> in the context menu provided by the bank menu icon or in other bank context menus. The window can be left visible and will update when selecting other banks. In addition, the global <span data-keyword="View"></span> menu also provides a visibility option for the bank Info window.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>In the <span data-keyword="Graphical">User Interface</span>, the bank Info window allows for editing the bank number (position in the bank list), name and comment text.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>

<!-- menu: location -->
<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html">User Manual</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-00-user-interfaces.html" data-number="4">User Interfaces</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-10-overviews.html" data-number="4.10">Overviews</a>
    </label>
</div>
<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.10">Overviews</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <p>There are different overviews provided on the <span data-keyword="Panel">Unit</span>, enabling the user to quickly get an impression of the inner workings of a particular sound, just by a brief glance at the <span data-keyword="Parameter">Panels</span>. Without listening to the sound or studying parameter values, certain assumptions on signal flow and modulation assignments can be easily made.</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary" data-detail="Panel Unit only">Active Overview</h3>
        <p>At any time, when the <span data-keyword="Preset">Screen</span> is in focus, active overview will be provided. Signal-flow related parameters that are not zero (<q>active</q>) will have lit LEDs. When <span data-keyword="Macro">Controls</span> are mapped to at least one parameter, they will show lit LEDs as well.</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">MC Target Overview</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="MC Target Overview (Panel Unit)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/gfk-mc-target-ovw.gif"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When a <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span> is selected, all assigned target parameters will show their assignment by blinking LEDs. This applies to parameters that are available on one of the <span data-keyword="Parameter">Panels</span>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">MC Target Overview</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="MC Target Overview (Graphical UI)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-mc-target-overview.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When a <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span> is selected, it will be surrounded by a red rectangle. All assigned target parameters show their assignment by surrounding red rectangles as well. In <span data-keyword="Split"></span>/<span data-keyword="Layer"></span> sounds, the <span data-keyword="Part"></span> in focus is reflected.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading primary" data-detail="Panel Unit only">MC Target Indicators</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Macro Control screen - target indicators">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-mc-target-indicators.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When a <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span> is selected, assigned Main parameters (not available on any <span data-keyword="Parameter">Panel</span>) are indicated by literal symbols in the <span data-keyword="Macro">Control Screen</span>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div data-columns="1">
            <table>
                <tr>
                    <th><code><b>M</b></code></th>
                    <td>Indicates assignments to Master Volume or Master Tune.</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <th><code><b>u</b></code></th>
                    <td>Indicates an assignment to Unison Detune. In a <span data-keyword="Split"></span> sound, the <span data-keyword="Part"></span> in focus is reflected.</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <th><code><b>m</b></code></th>
                    <td>Indicates an assignment to Mono Glide. In a <span data-keyword="Split"></span> sound, the <span data-keyword="Part"></span> in focus is reflected.</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <th><code><b>P</b></code></th>
                    <td>Indicates assignments to Part Volume, Part Tune (in <span data-keyword="Split"></span>/<span data-keyword="Layer"></span> Sounds) or the Split Point (only in <span data-keyword="Split"></span> sounds).</td>
                </tr>
            </table>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary" data-detail="Panel Unit only">Signal Flow Overview</h3>
        <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Signal Flow Overview (Panel Unit)">
            <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/gfk-flow-ovw.gif"></picture>
        </figure>
        <p>When selecting a parameter of a particular group, blinking LEDs on the <span data-keyword="Panel">Unit</span> show where the output signal of this group is applied further in the signal chain. (If, for example, a parameter of the Feedback Mixer is selected, the PM FB and FB Mix parameters of the Oscillators and Shapers will have blinking LEDs, if they are unequal to zero - indicating that the output signal of the Feedback Mixer is applied in these particular sections.</p>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>The Signal Flow indicator is optional and can be disabled in the <span data-keyword="Setup">Menu</span> (see chapter <a href="./documents/man-user/08-setup/08-setup.html" data-number="8">Setup (C15 System Settings)</a> for more details).</p>
        </div>
        <p><i>Furthermore, in <span data-keyword="Split"></span>/<span data-keyword="Layer"></span> sounds, the <span data-keyword="Sound">Screen</span>/<span data-keyword>Tab</span> can indicate send and feedback flow across <span data-keyword="Parts"></span>, as explained in <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-08-0-part-manipulation.html" data-number="4.8">Part Manipulation</a>.</i></p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Changed Overview</h3>
        <p>When a previously loaded preset has been edited, an asterisk (<code><b>*</b></code>) will be shown. It can refer to different elements, depending on the context.</p>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Changed Overview - Shift Button">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/mp-shift.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>On the <span data-keyword="Panel">Unit</span>, the <span data-keyword="Shift">Button</span> can be used to overview or navigate to changed elements.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <section>
            <h4 class="heading primary">Presets</h4>
            <div data-columns="2">
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset Screen - change indicator">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/preset/boled-pre-changed-indi.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <div>
                    <p>As mentioned in chapter <a href="./documents/man-user/03-basic-concepts/03-06-presets.html" data-number="3.6">Presets</a>, the <span data-keyword="Preset">Screen</span> will indicate changes (user edits) to a loaded preset by showing an asterisk behind the unique number. When changes occured to a loaded preset, holding the <span data-keyword="Shift">Button</span> while in the <span data-keyword="Preset">Screen</span> will show the Changed Overview on the <span data-keyword="Panel">Unit</span>, as changed parameters will now have blinking LEDs.</p>
                </div>
            </div>
            <h4 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Presets</h4>
            <div data-columns="2">
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Change indicators (Graphical UI)">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-param-chd-preset.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <div>
                    <p>In the <span data-keyword="Preset">Tab</span>, an asterisk will be shown as well. For each changed parameter, an additional yellow frame will be shown. The highlighting can be disabled in the <code><b>GUI Settings</b></code> tab of the Setup window.</p>
                </div>
            </div>
        </section>
        <section>
            <h4 class="heading primary">Parameters</h4>
            <div data-columns="2">
                <div>
                    <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Parameter Screen - change indicator">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-param-changed-indi.png"></picture>
                    </figure>
                    <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Compare Screen (Shift Button)">
                        <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-param-changed-comp.png"></picture>
                    </figure>
                </div> 
                <div>
                    <p>When a changed parameter is selected and visible in the <span data-keyword="Parameter">Screen</span>, an asterisk behind its label will be shown as well. Holding the <span data-keyword="Shift">Button</span> now will redirect to the <span data-keyword="Compare">Screen</span>, showing the loaded (original) and changed (edited) positions simultaneously. Both can be recalled by using <span data-keyword="Soft Buttons">2</span>/<span data-keyword>3</span>.</p>
                </div>
            </div>
            <h4 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Parameters</h4>
            <div data-columns="2">
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="changed Parameter indicators/options (Parameter Tab)">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-param-chd-param.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <div>
                    <p>When a changed parameter is selected and visible in the <span data-keyword="Parameter">Tab</span>, an asterisk behind its label will be shown as well. Furthermore, the previous state will be indicated left to the shown value. When selecting the previous state, it will be recalled.</p>
                </div>
            </div>
        </section>
        <section>
            <h4 class="heading primary">Parameter Modulation Aspects</h4>
            <div data-columns="2">
                <div>
                    <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Parameter Screen - changed modulation aspects">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-param-mod-changed-indi.png"></picture>
                    </figure>
                    <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Compare Screen - change modulation aspects (Shift Button)">
                        <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-param-mod-changed-rec.png"></picture>
                    </figure>
                </div>
                <div>
                    <p>When the modulation aspects of a parameter have changed, an asterisk will be shown for each <span data-keyword="Soft Button"></span> label. When a particular modulation aspect is in focus, the <span data-keyword="Shift">Button</span> can again be used to compare and recall states. <span data-keyword="Soft Buttons">2</span>/<span data-keyword>3</span> can be used to recall loaded/changed states and <span data-keyword="Soft Buttons">1</span>/<span data-keyword>4</span> can be used to navigate changed modulation aspects, as long as the <span data-keyword="Shift">Button</span> remains pressed.</p>
                </div>
            </div>
            <h4 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Parameter Modulation Aspects</h4>
            <div data-columns="2">
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="changed Parameter modulation aspects (Parameter Tab)">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-param-chd-aspect.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <div>
                    <p>When the modulation aspects of a parameter have changed, the modulation icon will appear with an additional yellow frame. After selecting the modulation icon, any changed modulation aspect will be shown with an additional yellow frame. Except for the Macro Control selector (just indicating the previous state), any particular aspect can be focussed by selecting the corresponding icon. With the aspect in focus, the previous state will be indicated left to the shown value. When selecting the previous state, it will be recalled.</p>
                </div>
            </div>
        </section>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Scale Overview</h3>
        <p>In order to quickly notice if any keys have an individual tuning (as controlled by the Scale group's Offset parameters), the Scale group provides an overview, showing if active (non-zero) offset parameters are present.</p>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Panel Unit">Scale Overview</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Scale group - indicator, reset (Soft Button 1)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/parameter/boled-param-scale-overview.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The active state is indicated by a highlighted bar for the Scale group in the selection stack, and when the Scale group is selected, a <code><b>Reset</b></code> option is provided by <span data-keyword="Soft Button">1</span>, which will set all active Offset parameters to zero when confirming with <span data-keyword="Enter"></span>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Scale Overview</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Scale group menu (Graphical UI)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-scale-active.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The active state is indicated by an exclamation mark <code><b>!</b></code> in the Scale group header, and a <code><b>Reset</b></code> option is provided by the header context menu, which will set all active Offset parameters to zero.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>
</body>
</html>

<!-- menu: location -->
<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html">User Manual</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-00-user-interfaces.html" data-number="4">User Interfaces</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-11-undo-mechanism.html" data-number="4.11">The Undo Mechanism</a>
    </label>

<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.11">The Undo Mechanism</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Simple Undo/Redo</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Undo/Redo Buttons (Edit Panel)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/mp-undo-redo.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The current, active branch can be navigated by using the <span data-keyword="Undo"></span>/<span data-keyword="Redo">Buttons</span> in the <span data-keyword="Edit">Panel</span>, recalling the corresponding state immediately.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset screen - Undo indicator">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/preset/boled-pre-undo-indi.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When the <span data-keyword="Undo">Button</span> was pressed, an Undo indicator will appear in the <span data-keyword="Preset">Screen</span>, showing that the <code><b>Redo</b></code> option is available. The <span data-keyword="Parameter">Screen</span> also shows the Undo indicator, as long as no other parameter is selected.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Simple Undo/Redo</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <div>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Undo/Redo icons">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/parameter/webui-undo-redo-buttons.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Undo/Redo keys">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/info-gfk/gfk-tast-undo-redo.png"></picture>
                </figure>
            </div>
            <div>
                <p>The current, active branch can be navigated by using the <span data-keyword="Undo"></span>/<span data-keyword="Redo">Icons</span> above the tab area, recalling the corresponding state immediately. The icons indicate which <code><b>Undo</b></code> options are available, as shown by their color. Alternatively, the usual keyboard shortcuts for undo and redo can be used.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Focus on Undo History</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Undo screen">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/txt/boled-undo-focus.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Pressing both <span data-keyword="Undo"></span>/<span data-keyword="Redo">Buttons</span> at once will invoke the <span data-keyword="Undo">Screen</span>, providing full navigation of the undo history.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Focus on Undo History</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="View menu - Undo">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-menu-show-undo.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>In the <span data-keyword="View"></span> menu, the Undo History window can be shown or hidden. It provides full access on undo-related aspects.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Navigate Current Branch</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <div>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Undo screen">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/txt/boled-undo-nav-current.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Undo navigation (Encoder, Dec/Inc Buttons)">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/mp-enc-dec-inc.png"></picture>
                </figure>
            </div>
            <div>
                <p>The <span data-keyword="Undo">Screen</span> can only show one branch of the undo tree. It can be scrolled by using the <span data-keyword="Encoder"></span> or <span data-keyword="Dec"></span>/<span data-keyword="Inc"></span>. The current position will be indicated by a rectangle and can be recalled by pressing <span data-keyword="Enter"></span>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Navigate Branches</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Undo branch navigation (Soft Buttons 1/3)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/mp-sb1-sb3-undo.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>If a branch splits at the current position, pointy brackets are visible on the entry. Use <span data-keyword="Soft Buttons">1</span>/<span data-keyword>3</span> to switch between branches. Recalling an entry of an inactive branch will make it active.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Navigate Branches</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Undo window">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-dia-undo-hist-window.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The Undo History window can be scrolled by drag gestures on the background or the scrollbar, or by using the mouse wheel. A simple click on an element will recall the corresponding state. As all branches of the tree are visible in this window, the branch navigation is fully integrated. A right-click (or long touch gesture) on an element provides a context menu for further options. The <code><b>hide</b></code> option will hide the selected branch, the other options follow below.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Delete (inactive) Branch</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Undo Edit screen - delete (Soft Button 4)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/txt/boled-undo-del-inactive.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When navigating an inactive branch, press <span data-keyword="Edit"></span> in order to get the <code><b>delete</b></code> option. Pressing <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span> will delete the whole branch.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Delete (inactive) Branch</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Undo window - entry option delete">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-dia-undo-hist-delete.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When the selected element is on an inactive branch, the <code><b>delete from here</b></code> option will be provided by a right-click. Confirming this option will delete the whole branch.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Make Element the new Root</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Undo Edit screen - make root (Soft Button 4)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/txt/boled-undo-make-root.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When navigating the current, active branch, press <span data-keyword="Edit"></span> in order to get the <code><b>Make Root</b></code> option. All entries and branches prior to the current position will be deleted by pressing <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Make Element the new Root</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Undo window - entry option make root">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-dia-undo-hist-makeroot.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When the selected element is on the current, active branch, the <code><b>Make this the new root</b></code> option will be provided by a right-click. Confirming this option will delete all elements and branches prior to the selected element.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>

<body class="main-grid" data-path="root/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-12-rename-mechanism">
<!-- menu: location -->
<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html">User Manual</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-00-user-interfaces.html" data-number="4">User Interfaces</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-12-rename-mechanism.html" data-number="4.12">The Rename Mechanism</a>
    </label>
</div>
<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.12">The Rename Mechanism</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3>Affected Items</h3>
        <p>Items that can be renamed are the labels and info texts of <span data-keyword="Macro">Controls</span>, as well as names and comment texts of presets and banks.</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Get Rename Option</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <div>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Edit Panel - Edit Button">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/mp-edit.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Macro Control Edit screen">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/txt/boled-txt-mc-rename-opt.png"></picture>
                </figure>
            </div>
            <div>
                <p>As previously described, renaming options will be provided when pressing <span data-keyword="Edit"></span> in the corresponding <span data-keyword>Screen</span>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">Get Rename Option</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Macro Control menu (Sound Tab)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-ctx-rename-option.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>As previously described, renaming options will be provided when invoking a context menu for corresponding items.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Rename Dialogs</h3>
        <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Rename Screen">
            <picture class="content" data-src="images/info-gfk/gfk-paneltast.png"></picture>
        </figure>
        <p>When the <span data-keyword="Rename">Screen</span> is shown, the two <span data-keyword="Parameter">Panels</span> on the left or on the right side of the display can be used as a keyboard, as indicated by the keyboard layout in the screen. The cursor can be moved by using the <span data-keyword="Encoder"></span> or <span data-keyword="Dec"></span>/<span data-keyword="Inc"></span>. <span data-keyword="Soft Button">1</span> will cancel the process, <span data-keyword="Soft Button">4</span> will apply the process.</p>
        <h3 class="heading secondary" data-detail="Graphical UI">The Rename Screen</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Rename Dialogs">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-dia-rename-preset-bank-macro.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When a rename option was called, a dialog window will appear, containing an entry or textbox element. Mouse and keyboard on the external device can be used to rename the corresponding item. Dialogs provide OK and Cancel buttons in order to finish the process accordingly.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>
</body>

<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.13">Setup Navigation</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <p>This section explains the navigation to and within the <span data-keyword="Setup">Menu</span>. Refer to chapter <a href="./documents/man-user/08-setup/08-setup.html" data-number="8">Setup (C15 System Settings)</a> for a detailed reference.</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Focus on Setup Menu</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Edit Panel - Setup Button">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/mp-setup.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Press the <span data-keyword="Setup">Button</span> in order to invoke the <span data-keyword="Setup">Screen</span>. The menu content is organized in different levels which can be entered.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Scrolling</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Setup screen">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/setup/boled-setup-scroll.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Scroll the menu by using the <span data-keyword="Encoder"></span> or <span data-keyword="Dec"></span>/<span data-keyword="Inc"></span>. The position will be indicated by a highlighted background.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Enter a Submenu/Property</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Setup screen - enter submenu (Enter Button, Soft Buttons 3/4)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/setup/boled-setup-enter-sub.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Press <span data-keyword="Enter"></span> or <span data-keyword="Soft Buttons">3</span>/<span data-keyword>4</span> in order to enter a submenu or a menu property, according to the current position.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Adjust a Property</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Setup screen - property adjustments (Encoder, Dec/Inc Buttons)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/setup/boled-setup-adjust-prop.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When focussing on a property, adjustments can be done like editing a parameter, by using the <span data-keyword="Encoder"></span> or <span data-keyword="Dec"></span>/<span data-keyword="Inc"></span>.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Escape a Submenu/Property</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Setup screen - leave submenu (Enter Button, Soft Buttons 1/2)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/setup/boled-setup-esc-sub.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p><span data-keyword="Soft Buttons">1</span>/<span data-keyword>2</span> can be used to navigate back to the next higher level. When a property is in focus, <span data-keyword="Enter"></span> has the same effect.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary" data-detail="Graphica UI only">Setup Window</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Setup window">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/setup/webui-setup-device-settings.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The topright <span data-keyword="View"></span> menu provides the <code><b>Setup</b></code> option, toggling the visibility of the Setup window. The menu content is organized in tabs which can be focussed. In each tab, the corresponding properties are provided and can be adjusted (some properties have context menus, some can be adjusted by drag gestures, like a parameter).</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>

<!-- menu: location -->
<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html">User Manual</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-00-user-interfaces.html" data-number="4">User Interfaces</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-14-backups.html" data-number="4.14">Backups</a>
    </label>
</div>
<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.14">Backups</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <p>As previously mentioned, single banks can be imported and exported from and to either a connected USB stick or the connected external device. In addition, the transfer of all banks at once is also provided, which allows for fast and easy backups.</p>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>We recommend creating backups of your banks regularly. Although the C15 can hold an arbitrary number of banks, it can be helpful to keep the interface clean by not overloading it with banks, speeding up booting, backup and shutdown processes. Using single backup files for bank collections may also be helpful for live musicians who may need to load their presets on a C15.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary" data-detail="Panel Unit only">Saving and Restoring Backups on USB Stick</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Setup screen - Backups">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/boled/setup/boled-setup-backup.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>In the <span data-keyword="Setup">Screen</span>, the <code><b>Backup</b></code> submenu can be found, providing a <code><b>Restore all Banks...</b></code> and a <code><b>Save all Banks...</b></code> option. It will be indicated when a USB stick is connected, pressing <span data-keyword="Enter"></span> will then allow for exporting or restoring of backups.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <h3 class="heading primary" data-detail="Graphical UI only">Saving and Restoring Backups on External Device</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Background menu - Backup options">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-ctx-save-restore-banks.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>The background menu of the <span data-keyword="Graphical">User Interface</span> provides options for saving and restoring backups. When <code><b>Save all Banks as Backup File</b></code> is selected, all banks will be copied into a single file which then will be downloaded on the external device. (You will find the downloaded file at a location depending on your browser settings.)</p>
                <p>When <code><b>Restore all Banks from Backup File</b></code> is selected, a backup file present on the external device can be chosen and uploaded.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>Please keep in mind that when restoring from a backup file, all banks currently present on the C15 will be lost. We recommend to save a backup file before restoring in order to maintain all preset data.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>
</body>
</html>

<!-- menu: location -->

<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.15">Base Unit Functionality</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <p>Here is a quick recap of the <span data-keyword="Base">Unit</span> functionality, compiling all available features into a single overview.</p>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Base Unit Control Panel - Mode Button">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/soled-bup-mode-cycle.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The <span data-keyword="Mode">Button</span> cycles four distinct operation modes, which are explained in the following. The functionality of the remaining buttons depends on the current mode.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <p>The following illustration shows how to navigate between the different modes:</p>
        <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Base Unit Operation Modes">
            <picture class="content" data-src="images/info-gfk/gfk-mode-cycle.png"></picture>
        </figure>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Base Unit - Play Mode">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/soled-bup-play-mode.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div class="section">
                <p>In <code><b>Play</b></code> mode, both <span data-keyword="Ribbons"></span> function as ordinary <span data-keyword="Hardware">Sources</span>. If they are assigned to a <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span>, they will be operable. </p>
                <p>The <span data-keyword="+"></span>/<span data-keyword="-">Buttons</span> can be used for transposing the whole instrument (note shift). Pressing a single button will perform an octave shift, pressing one button while holding the other will perform a semitone shift.</p>
                <p>The <span data-keyword="Funct">Button</span> switches between absolute and relative behavior for the most recently used <span data-keyword="Ribbon"></span> (indicated by a pointy bracket).</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Base Unit - Edit Mode (Ribbon 1)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/soled-bup-edit-mode.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>In <code><b>Edit</b></code> mode, <span data-keyword="Ribbon">1</span> will operate as an additional <span data-keyword="Parameter">Editor</span> for the current parameter focus. The remaining functionality remains as described for the <code><b>Play</b></code> mode.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Base Unit - Bank Mode">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/soled-bup-bank-mode.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>In <code><b>Bank</b></code> mode, both <span data-keyword="Ribbons"></span> remain operable as <span data-keyword="Hardware">Sources</span>. The <span data-keyword="+"></span>/<span data-keyword="-">Buttons</span> can be used to navigate banks.The <span data-keyword="Funct">Button</span> will serve as a <code><b>Direct Load</b></code> switch (when held for a second). The last selected preset of the corresponding bank will be loaded.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Base Unit - Preset Mode">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/hardware-ui/panels/soled-bup-preset-mode.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>In <code><b>Preset</b></code> mode, both Ribbons remain operable as <span data-keyword="Hardware">Sources</span>. The <span data-keyword="+"></span>/<span data-keyword="-">Buttons</span> can be used to navigate presets. The <span data-keyword="Funct">Button</span> will serve as a <code><b>Load</b></code> button (when pressed) or as a <code><b>Direct Load</b></code> switch (when held for a second).</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>
</body>
</html>

<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.16">Graphical UI Functionality</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <p>There are some more features of the <span data-keyword="Graphical">User Interface</span>, which are not available on both <span data-keyword="Base"></span>/<span data-keyword="Panel">Unit</span>. Other features are available on both User Interfaces, but are organized in different ways.</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">GUI Shortcuts</h3>
        <p>For a detailed reference of all available keyboard shortcuts see chapter <a href="./documents/man-user/13-kb-shortcuts/13-kb-shortcuts.html" data-number="13">Shortcuts for the Graphical User Interface</a>.</p>
    </section>
</main>

<body class="main-grid" data-path="root/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-16-graphical-ui-functionality/04-16-1-presets">
<!-- menu: location -->
<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html">User Manual</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-00-user-interfaces.html" data-number="4">User Interfaces</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-16-0-graphical-ui-functionality.html" data-number="4.16">Graphical UI Functionality</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-16-1-gui-presets.html" data-number="4.16.1">Presets</a>
    </label>
</div>
<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.16.1">Presets</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Preset Search</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <div>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset Search icon (Preset Tab)">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-preset-search-button.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset Search windo">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-dia-preset-search.png"></picture>
                </figure>
            </div>
            <div class="section">
                <p>All available presets can be searched for keywords, the search results will be highlighted until the search is canceled. Search keywords can be logically combined by setting the logical operator (<code><b>AND</b></code>: every keyword has to match, <code><b>OR</b></code>: any keyword that matches). The search algorithm can further be specified to include preset names, preset comments and the device names where presets originated from (as the selectable options show in the Search window).</p>
                <p>The <code><b>Zoom to all matches</b></code> option will set the zoom level of the main area, so that every match is instantly visible. The <code><b>Load Highlighted Preset</b></code> option enables the <code><b>Previous</b></code> and <code><b>Next</b></code> buttons to cycle through each Preset of the search result. The currently loaded Preset has a strong highlighting.</p>
                <p>The success of a search strongly depends on the level of documentation (meaningful preset names and descriptive comments). Bank information (comments) are not included in the search. Using hashtags for specific keywords can be a sophisticated method of preset search and documentation.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Preset Drag and Drop</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset Drag and Drop">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-preset-dnd.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>A selected preset can be dragged on other positions in a bank, into other banks or on the background. When it is dropped, it will move to the new position (if the bank remains the same), or it will be copied to the new position (creating a new bank if it was dropped on the background). If a preset is dropped directly on another preset (as indicated by a red background), the other preset will be replaced. In a similar manner, banks can be dragged as well in order to change their position in the main area, or to copy their contents into other banks.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Multiple Preset Selection</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <div>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Multiple Preset Selection menus">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-ctx-multi-select.png"></picture>
                </figure>
                <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Shift key">
                    <picture class="content" data-src="images/info-gfk/gfk-tast-shift.png"></picture>
                </figure>
            </div>
            <div>
                <p>Bank context menus (invoked by a right-click or long touch gesture on a bank in the main area) provide an option to start and finish the selection of multiple presets. Alternatively, the Shift key can be used to hold the multiple selection mode. During multiple selection, presets of any bank can be added or removed from the selection (but they will not be loaded). All selected presets can then be deleted or copied (see context menu), or dragged into any bank at any position or on the background, creating a new bank containing copies of the selected presets. The selection of multiple presets can be finished in the context menu or by a click on the background.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>Note that Preset Drag and Drop and Multiple Preset Selection are only available, if the GUI Settings (explained below) allow for context menus and drag and drop.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Preset Compare</h3>
        <p>Two presets can be compared against each other, examining their individual differences. This may be useful for distinguishing several versions of a preset that are only slightly different. Two compare methods are available, as shown in the following:</p>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset Compare - selected presets">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-ctx-preset-compare.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Using the multiple preset selection mechanism and selecting two presets, a context menu entry <code><b>Compare ...</b></code> will be available when right-clicking on the selection. The two presets will be compared against each other.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset Compare - compare to Editbuffer">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-ctx-preset-buff-comp.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>A right-click on any preset will provide a <code><b>Compare to Editbuffer ...</b></code> option. The preset will be compared to a copy of the <span data-keyword="Edit">Buffer</span> (the current parameter settings).</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset Compare window">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-dia-preset-comp.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When starting the compare mechanism by either method, the Compare window will appear, showing every parameter or aspect that differs between the two presets. Equal parameters or aspects are not visible. Any of the two presets can be loaded, as provided by a Load icon in the header section of the window (so, both presets can be tested and played without closing the Compare window). When comparing a preset to the <span data-keyword="Edit">Buffer</span>, subsequent adjustments to parameters that change the Editbuffer will not be recognized by the Compare window automatically. The <code><b>Refresh</b></code> button can be used in order to get a new copy of the current Editbuffer, ensuring that the comparison is up-to-date.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>
</body>
</html>

<!-- menu: location -->
<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html">User Manual</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-00-user-interfaces.html" data-number="4">User Interfaces</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-16-0-graphical-ui-functionality.html" data-number="4.16">Graphical UI Functionality</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-16-2-gui-banks.html" data-number="4.16.2">Banks</a>
    </label>
</div>
<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.16.2">Banks</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Move all Banks</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Background menu - Move all Banks option">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-ctx-move-all-banks.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>There is a shortcut to move all banks at the same time, provided by the global context menu (invoked by a right-click or long touch gesture on the background). If the <code><b>Move all Banks</b></code> option is selected, a white rectangle will appear, surrounding all banks. Drag gestures now allow for moving all banks to another place in the main area. To stop, re-select the option or click on the background.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Collapse Banks</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Bank menu - Collapse option">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-ctx-collapse-banks.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The local bank context menu provides an option to collapse a bank. A double click on a bank header has the same effect. When a bank is collapsed, it will consume only a small space, but still provides access to all contained presets (the access is only sequential, though).</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Docking Banks</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Bank Drag and Drop - docking">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-dock-banks.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>When dragging banks manually to certain positions in the main area, they might not align very well. In order to create an alignment, a bank can be docked to another by dragging it close to other banks. The bank outlines change, indicating possible docking targets (top, right, bottom, left) for the dragged bank. When banks are docked together, they also behave as a group that can be dragged as a whole or docked to larger bank clusters. The top- or leftmost bank of a cluster behaves as the master and will move the whole cluster when dragging it, while the other banks can be dragged away from the cluster in order to split the group back into individual parts. Furthermore, when dragging a single bank between two banks of a cluster, it can be inserted as well.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>Banks can be docked ontop of each other as a vertical cluster. When minimizing or maximizing an individual bank, the cluster will maintain the alignment and shift the other banks accordingly.</p>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Sort Bank Numbers</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Background menu - Sort Bank Numbers">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-ctx-sort-banks.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The background context menu provides an option to sort the bank numbers. This will re-evaluate their order in the bank list, which is available by sequential access in the <span data-keyword="Preset">Screen</span>/<span data-keyword>Tab</span>. The new order will be affected by clusters (which will be evaluated first), and the bank positions on the main area or within a cluster (from upper left to lower right).</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>
</body>
</html>

<!-- menu: location -->
<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html">User Manual</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-00-user-interfaces.html" data-number="4">User Interfaces</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-16-0-graphical-ui-functionality.html" data-number="4.16">Graphical UI Functionality</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-16-3-gui-view-menu.html" data-number="4.16.3">The View Menu</a>
    </label>
</div>
<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.16.3">The View Menu</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="View Menu">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-view-menu.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The View menu (available in the top-right corner, indicated by a menu icon) provides quick access to crucial components of the <span data-keyword="Graphical">User Interface</span>. The following components can be made visible or invisible (GUI shortcuts to the components are shown as well).</p>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div data-columns="1">
            <table>
                <tr>
                    <th>Setup</th>
                    <td>When clicking this option, the Setup menu opens in a new window. For more information about the Setup menu, refer to chapter <a href="./documents/man-user/08-setup/08-setup.html" data-number="8">Setup (C15 System Settings)</a>.</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <th>Preset Search</th>
                    <td>As described, presets can be searched for keywords. Click on this option to start a search task, opening the Search window.</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <th>Undo History</th>
                    <td>All user actions are tracked and can be undone, as provided by <span data-keyword="Undo"></span>/<span data-keyword="Redo">Icons</span> above the tab area. In order to have a complete overview or browse through the history, the Undo History window can be used, showing all tracked actions in a tree-like structure.</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <th>Preset Info</th>
                    <td>Every preset contains metadata, such as a comment text or the creation date, for example. All the preset-relevant information is provided by the Preset Info window.</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <th>Bank Info</th>
                    <td>Similarly, banks also contain metadata which will be provided by the Bank Info window.</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <th>Parameter Info</th>
                    <td>In addition, specific parameter information will be provided by the Parameter Info window.</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <th>Presets</th>
                    <td>All the floating banks in the main area can also be shown or hidden, shifting the focus to the parameters. Nevertheless, all banks still are available in the <span data-keyword="Preset">Tab</span>.</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <th>Parameter Editor</th>
                    <td>All parameters in the main area can also be shown or hidden, shifting the focus to presets and banks. The <span data-keyword="Parameter">Tab</span> still provides the opportunity to edit a selected parameter. However, parameters cannot be selected anymore (the <span data-keyword="Hardware">User Interface</span> still provides complete access).</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <th>Open Manual</th>
                    <td>The <a href="./index.html" target="_blank">C15 Documentation</a> is also available as a separate HTML document, which will open in a new browser tab.</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <th>
                        <p>Open <span data-keyword="MC">View</span>,</p>
                        <p>Open <span data-keyword="Recorder"></span></p>
                    </th>
                    <td>Open the <span data-keyword="MC">View</span> or <span data-keyword="Recorder"></span> <i>(see below)</i> in a new browser tab.</td>
                </tr>
            </table>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Open MC View</h3>
        <figure class="border maximize" data-label="MC View">
            <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-mc-view.png"></picture>
        </figure>
        <p>The <span data-keyword="MC">View</span> is an experimental feature which allows for a more dynamic, screen-based interaction with <span data-keyword="Macro">Controls</span>. By clicking on this menu option, a separate browser tab will be opened, providing two XY controls and two large sliders, representing the Macro Controls. Their positions are following mouse or touch gestures with a smoothed speed. At the left edge, the settings can be accessed. They contain:</p>
        <ul>
            <li>the amount of additional smoothing</li>
            <li>an option to assign <span data-keyword="Macro">Control</span> &#xE102; and &#xE103; to the second XY field or to the two horizontal sliders</li>
        </ul>
        <div data-highlight="note">
            <p>Note that the provided smoothing times are completely separate of the <code><b>Edit Smoothing Time</b></code> (found in the <span data-keyword="Device Settings"></span> of the <span data-keyword="Setup">Menu</span>) as well as the Macro Control Smoothing Times (found below each Macro Control slider in the <span data-keyword="Graphical">User Interface</span>).</p>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Open Recorder</h3>
        <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Recorder">
            <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/recorder/webui-recorder.png"></picture>
        </figure>
        <p>The <span data-keyword="Recorder"></span> is a new feature which allows for recording audio material, see chapter <a href="./documents/man-user/06-recorder/06-recorder.html" data-number="6">Recorder</a>.</p>
    </section>
</main>
</div>
</body>

<!-- menu: location -->
<div class="main-grid" id="menu-wrapper">
    <label id="menu-location" class="label reverse">
        <a href="./index.html">C15 Documentation</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/index.html">User Manual</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-00-user-interfaces.html" data-number="4">User Interfaces</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-16-0-graphical-ui-functionality.html" data-number="4.16">Graphical UI Functionality</a>
        <span>/</span>
        <a href="./documents/man-user/04-user-interfaces/04-16-4-gui-context-menus.html" data-number="4.16.4">Context Menus</a>
    </label>
</div>
<!-- document content -->
<div id="content-wrapper">
<main>
    <section>
        <h2 data-number="4.16.4">Context Menus</h2>
    </section>
    <section>
        <p>There are several context menus available providing different functionalities (according to the context). They all can be closed by pressing the Escape key.</p>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Background Context Menu</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Background Context Menu">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-ctx-bg.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The Background context menu appears when right-clicking on the background. Alternatively, a long touch gesture can be used to invoke the menu. The menu provides global functionality such as creating a new bank, importing a bank (from the external device), saving or restoring back-ups and moving all banks at once.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Preset Context Menu</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Preset Context Menu">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-ctx-preset.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>There are a two ways to invoke the Preset context menu. In the <span data-keyword="Preset">Tab</span>, a menu icon is provided for presets. In addition, a right-click (or long touch gesture) on a preset (in the Preset Tab or in the main area) can also be used. The menu provides preset-specific functionalities such as handling multiple preset selection, an option to show the Preset Info window, a rename option, cut/copy/paste/delete options for selected presets, the compare option and a fast way to change the color tag of selected presets.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Bank Context Menu</h3>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Bank Context Menu">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-ctx-bank.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The Bank context menu can be invoked by the Bank menu icon in the <span data-keyword="Preset">Tab</span>, or by a right-click (or long touch gesture) on any bank header (in the Preset Tab or in the main area). Depending on where the Bank context menu was invoked, different functionalities will be provided. In general, the following options are provided: create a new bank, import/export a bank (from/to the external device), an option to show the Bank Info window, a rename option, copy/paste/delete options, move left/right options and the collapse/expand option.</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section>
        <h3 class="heading primary">Parameter Context Menus</h3>
        <p>Finally, all parameters and all parameter group headers also provide a context menu in order to adjust parameter-specific behaviors. Similar to the other context menus, they can be invoked by right-clicking on an element, or by using a long touch gesture.</p>
        <div data-columns="2">
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Hardware Source Context Menu">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-ctx-hw-source.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>In the Hardware Sources and Amounts group, the <code><b>Return Behavior</b></code> of <span data-keyword="Pedals"></span>/<span data-keyword="Ribbons"></span> can be set.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Macro Control Context Menu">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-ctx-mc.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p><span data-keyword="Macro">Controls</span> provide options for renaming, viewing the Parameter Info window (showing their user-definable info text) and resetting (clearing all mappings to target parameters).</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Group Context Menu">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-ctx-group.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>Each group header additionally provides local (affecting the specific group) and global (affecting all groups) locking options.</p>
            </div>
            <figure class="border maximize" data-label="Parameter Context Menu">
                <picture class="content" data-src="images/web-ui/txt/webui-ctx-param.png"></picture>
            </figure>
            <div>
                <p>The Parameter context menu provides an option to get the parameter info (by showing the Parameter Info window) or view the parameter in the <span data-keyword="Parameter">Tab</span> (if not already visible).</p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
</main>
</div>
</body>
</html>
